tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We were so happy when we knew that my wife was Pregnant, we were excited and scared at the same time as it was her first pregnancy. 

As a couple we had a huge list of recommendations from friends and relatives about various doctors we could consult. 

Our first and foremost requirement at the time was to find a warm and caring doctor that we were comfortable with. 

One by one we visited 7 doctors (some with an Attitude, some with a prescription for various scans within 2min of meeting and also from a particular Lab and a Particular Technician, some wouldn‚Äôt allow the Husband in the consulting room, some speak only Medical jargons makes it so difficult to follow, some scare you that its going to be a caesarean on the first visit) and finally we met Dr Manjula Deepak.

After the first interaction with Dr Manjula my wife was so happy and so excited and was so confident in saying that she is going to be our doctor, though the Hospital was never on our list (it was on the higher end ‚Çπ compared to other Hospitals), the whole day I just heard from my wife that the doctor was like this, like that, she told this, she said don‚Äôt worry, she was not in a hurry, she answered all my queries etc‚Ä¶

When you meet Dr Manjula, she is full of Energy, Positivity, Compassionate, Warm, speaks to you in the most humble and simplified manner, like speaking to a child. What one expects from a doctor apart for their expertise is that feel, that when u meet a doctor that everything is going to be fine, she will be there when you need her, she will comfort you when you are in pain, she will move any obstacles in your way, and all you have to do is rest your faith in her hands.

We have never felt that a scan was prescribed unnecessarily, that a Blood test was prescribed unnecessarily, that a medicine was prescribed unnecessarily. She has always ensured that only the required Treatment was provided.

She was available on the phone whenever you have a query (big or small), though she is almost always the busiest doctor in the Hospital 24x7 (Consult her once and you will know what i mean).

On the Final day we were at the Hospital at 10pm in the LDR, by then Dr Manjula had instructed the fellow doctors about the next steps, she visited us at 11 in the night (prior to this we only met her in the morning) and comforted us and mentioned we had time and that she will be back the next morning at 7am. We were waiting in the room that night, Dr Manjula comes in the room at 4am she happened to be there as another patient of hers delivered, she was there to check and left after sometime, only to return at 6 am to again check on us, this time we were worried, as my wife wasn‚Äôt responding to the Treatment, she politely told us to wait till 9 am. And then she returned and still my wife wasn‚Äôt responding to the Treatment, they tried inducing pain but it was all but clear that we have to prepare ourselves for a caesarean, we had time only till 1pm for a Normal delivery. So we waited and suddenly at 12 the doctors hurried to the room, called Dr Manjula, it was time, all the doctors encouraged, cajoled, reminded that it was all in my wife‚Äôs hands for a Normal delivery. Can still hear Dr Manjula shouting that ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to do a caesarean, you had come to me months ago asking for a Normal delivery, now you need to push, you are so close, please push‚Äù.

It‚Äôs a boy, he was delivered normally. It was an ordeal for us for almost 14 hours but all through, Dr Manjula was right there‚Ä¶

She was there every step of the way till the most crucial time, supporting, helping, guiding and by the Grace of God we have Dr Manjula as our Doctor. As a Husband a brother a friend and a fellow human being I would always recommend that you get a doctor as good as Doctor Manjula Deepak‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
reply_text: Thank you very much Sridhar for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
My husband and I was pregnant with our first child. We researched for a good gynecologist and came across Dr Manjula's profile in practo. With all the good stories shared we decided to consult her and I would say that was the best decision we made for our pregnancy journey.

She has a very charismatic personality with full of energy and positive attitude. In our first visit, being a first timer, we had a lot of questions. To our surprise we got answers to all of them without asking. This shows her rich experience in dealing with the subject where she understands the mindset of new going to be parents. And the same happened in our every visit. She gave all the information required for the time without we worrying to ask. And she was always available on whatsapp for any emergency query.
Another thing which was very impressive about her was that she doesn‚Äôt prescribes any fancy procedure or medicine. She suggests all the natural ways and procedures, natural homely remedies , homely supplements etc. On the medicine front too, i was never loaded with a lot of tests and tablets. I had a very smooth and happy pregnancy. 
There was a point where we were thoughts of going to our hometown for helping hands during COVID. But it was just and just for the doctor and our confidence on her that we stayed back. And we are very happy with our decision.
We wanted NVD and again it was for the doctor that we were able to achieve it. My labor was long where at a point we broke down and was thinking of going for C-section. But doctor Manjula showed high confidence and kept convincing us to wait for a little longer. Finally, i delivered a healthy baby normally. She supported me though post delivery period too where i was very nervous about recovery of my mind and body. 
Her AURA is magical. Meeting her always made me happy even in my lowest of mood a 5-minute chat with her made me relaxed and feel better.
During COVID where cloudnine only allows one parent to enter the hospital/doctor's cabin , she made sure my husband was involved equally in the journey. She spoke to my husband over phone/virtually in our every visit and kept him updated with all the progress our baby was making. 
A great doctor, a beautiful soul and above all a great human being. I highly highly appreciate and recommend her. She is a full package of great subject expertise and amazing consulting skills, she was everything I wanted from my gynecologist. 
Doctor Manjula, may you always be super gorgeous, super fit and kicking . You will always stay in my heart. God bless you !!
reply_text: Thank you very much Tanvi for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: Basis on the Google review , I went to consult with doctor Manjula Deepak.  As this was my first pregnancy I was unsure whom to consult. I'm still not sure of these reviews are true or are all false. When I met her as a person she was really nice to talk , she kept a smile on her face and answered all the queries. All my reports were normal . She advised me with few exercise for having normal delivery and I religiously abide by her instructions. I was very happy thinking my doctor understands me and she is also trying for normal delivery.  I was very close to my due date which was on 10th of Feb but unfortunately  I did not get my labour , I became very worried and went to doctor. I was asked to do a scan to check the water level and to see if everything was fine. Thankfully everything came as normal. I checked with the doctor if she can induce but she refused and asked me to relax and go home and wait for the normal labour. I waited and waited for the normal labour  but unfortunately It did not happen, but I made sure basis on the dates given by the doctor I visited her with no fail. Now I was 42 weeks pregnant. Every one was worried home because according to them it was very late but thankfully doctor Manjula Deepak gave me the confidence nothing to worry. Finally I got a little pain and decided to admit in the hospital (cloud nine) at night 6 pm on Sunday while she was feeding her babies. She asked me to leave and get admited on Monday as on Sunday there are only limited staff. As I was very worried because of my past due date I became reluctant to go back. She arrived on at 8pm and decided to break the water and immediately decided to take me for c section  **** ** **** ******* I was absolutely fine till than. I was so shocked as they started giving me injection and took my signature and took in the OT ,And send my husband to pay the bill by the time he came back I was given the anesthesia in my spine. *** ***** ***** *** ****** *** **** *** **** *** **** *** ******* *** ****** ****  With in few minutes she finished the surgery and rushed home ** *** ****** *** **** **** ****** * *** ********** ** * ******* ********* *** **** ********* **** ******** ***** She didn't even come to meet me post surgery.*** ******* *** *** **** ***** * *** ********** ***** ** *** ***** ** *********  I have very bad   back  pain. ** **** ** ********** ****** *** * ***** **** ** **** I have a constant pain in my back.  When I asked dr what shall I do as the pain never went after 6months of delivery,  I was  been advised to  met an orthopedic doctor from specialist hospital. I consulted doctor and done physiotherapy ******* ** **** *** ***** **** ** ****** * *** ** ***** I'm on bed rest from past 7months ***** ***** ** ** *********** ** ** **** ***** Now I'm really not sure whom to consult. ***** ** ****** ** *** ****** ****** *** ************ ** ******* *** **** **** ** ******** *****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I could plan a second child just to be under Dr. Manjula Deepak's care! :)  I think this gives you an absolutely clear idea of my trust, respect and admiration for this passionate and highly experienced individual. You will see the same respect in the eyes of the people who work with her too.

I met Dr. Manjula Deepak at Cloudnine Hospital in HRBR when I was 4 weeks pregnant and was recommended by a friend ( PS: she is extremely popular amongst her past patients and rightly so.).

My first consultation with Dr. Manjula Deepak allowed me to experience her positive and energetic nature. She is so passionate and thorough that she remembers more about you than you do about your own case. She understands the anxiety levels of the mom-to-be and responds on messages for any queries. 

I remember, I had a dicey first trimester which made me really anxious, low and under-confident but every time I would meet doctor she gave me so much confidence and hope. Most importantly, I always wanted to have a normal delivery and when I was 3 cm dilated, doctor sat me and my husband down to explain the process of delivery and comforted us. She patiently waited and encouraged me for a normal delivery till the end (yes, through 12 hours of labor!), she ensured that I was absolutely comfortable during the labor and took precious time from her busy schedule to bring our baby into this world via normal delivery.

I still remember what she told me when I was 10 weeks pregnant ‚Äì ‚ÄúI will give you a baby, don‚Äôt worry‚Äù and boy she did :) We were blessed with a baby boy this May, filling our life with abundance and happiness for which we are extremely grateful to her..

One thing I absolutely love about her is she is very honest and tells you like it is. During my pregnancy, she encouraged me to have a healthy weight gain (which most doctors don‚Äôt really care about much) and whenever I would waiver from the track set for me by the nutritionist she would tell me that its not going to help me or my goal of normal delivery and kept me focused.  Thanks to her advice and encouragement I am already 2 kgs away from my pre-pregnancy weight, Yay!

Finally, she is someone I look upto as her passion is infectious and something we could all imbibe. Every time I cross cloud nine or go to cloud nine for my baby‚Äôs consultation, my eyes keep searching for her. She still remembers my name even after all this time and always offers her warm smile and banter whenever I greet her. She is an amazing human being and an extra ordinary doctor in this field where most are looking to mint money! 

I highly highly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak if you are looking to bring a little one into your lives :)
reply_text: Thank you Mayuri for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
Me and my wife are writing this review with a deep gratitude in our heart for Dr Manjula Deepak for her support and guidance throughout the pregnancy journey. 

We were consulting a different Gynec initially and we had an emergency, but did not get a satisfying response when we wanted an advise. So, I did reach out to my close friend who were also expecting a baby for his suggestion for a good Gynec. He referred us to Dr Manjua Deepak and that‚Äôs where our journey started, which turned out to be an amazing decision of choosing her. I am so thankful to my friend too for doing so. 

Am sure, this review will help many such couples who can just walk up to Dr Manjula without any second thought and they will have a similar experience.

1.	Firstly, she is so friendly that at your first visit you feel so comfortable. She listen to your problems and comforts us by assuring that the problem is handled at ease, which is an amazing quality as a Doctor

2.	From the first visit itself we had gained confidence that we felt we are in safe hands

3.	My wife had to undergo a Cyst surgery when she was in her start of 3rd month of pregnancy and we both were so tensed but she had assured everything to be fine with the baby and rightly by the grace of god everything was fine

4.	We were always given a heads-up on upcoming symptoms/ body changes which helped my wife to be mentally ready

5.	Whatever the Scan reports say, she has never created a panic mode in us, which is so great of her

6.	She was available on WhatsApp for any kind of emergency (Suggest not to message a Doctor unless it is an emergency)

7.	My wife preferred a normal delivery, but due to situation we ended up deciding for C-section a day before she delivered. But Dr Manjula just walked up to the Labour room that night and comforted and gave assurance for a normal delivery irrespective of the situation which made us to re-think on our decision and agreed for Normal delivery. She proved that she was right which made us so happy

8.	Our baby was early by 5 weeks, doctor had to deliver the baby at 34 weeks. It was not a surprise for us, as doctor had hinted this right from 5th month of pregnancy and was monitoring closely. We were in a much better position because of her positivity and assurance. 

9.	It was such a great feeling to see my baby next to my wife within an hour of delivery

10.	Never seen a doctor be so committed towards their patients 

Words fall short enough to appreciate the service you do. You have been a great human being first and doctor next. Thank you for all your service, you will be remembered always by both of us and our family. Wishing you greater heights and success in your carrier :-) 


Mithun Somaiah & Divya

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: This comes a little late but here is my note of my journey with Dr. Manjula Deepak. I thank God for having given me the best doctor who like an angel so wonderfully saw me through the whole process of having a baby. Dr. Manjula was my second doctor whom I consulted for my cyst and enquire about having a baby as my husband and I were planning for a baby. My husband and I had planned to meet another doctor in the same hospital but by Gods grace we got directed to meet Dr. Manjula. Initially I was very nervous and skeptical about our first visit. Meeting her in person instantly made us feel so welcomed and the conversation was so friendly and yet professional. Talking to her about my condition and the concerns I had was so comfortable, I felt for the first time that someone truly heard me out and understood my condition. The counseling she offered encouraged us and made us feel so optimistic about having a baby very soon despite my cyst. I truly enjoyed my follow up visits, doctor was so friendly and taught me to take things positively and to enjoy the process and assured me time and again not to worry. Those visits truly boosted my spirit and lifted hopes up. By the end of my third follow up checkup I had totally forgotten about my cyst condition because I that hopeful and knew I was heading in the right direction to having a baby. Per her guidance and medication, I began to follow them strictly. Dr. Manjula assured that within 3 months I can get conceived and per her word I got conceived with my first baby. Post pregnancy, we had timely and meaningful visits and through the process doctor took time to explain each phase of my pregnancy and kept us informed about our babys growth. Her medications and guidance was more than sufficient for both me and the baby. What I really appreciate is the passion Dr. Manjula has in her job, not many doctors come forward like her to go the extra mile to assure wellness of both the mother and the baby. I felt so secure and safe through every phase. Even if I couldnt consult face to face, she was always reachable over WhatsApp or phone call to enquire any concerns or recommend medication. Eventually in my visits to Dr. Manjula, I became so accustomed, we would wait to meet her again. Despite her busy schedule she is so hospitable and knows how to accommodate her patients and always treated us with so much respect and care. She kept us informed of what was upcoming and how I should respond to them, by that I was never too anxious for anything in the process. Some of the nurses also mentioned about how Dr. Manjula was looking forward to meet me and kept a tab on how I was doing. Even at the point of delivery, she took so much care that she even was willing to deliver my baby separately. She helped me to be prepared mentally and physically for what was going to happen during delivery. She ensures that both of us as husband and wife are present and kept my husband informed of how he can aid and support me. She took the time to be there to induce the pain for me herself and promised me that 99% everything is going to be good and we neednt worry. Doctor told that I should deliver the baby between 4am to 7am, but by Gods grace my baby started to come earlier. I was so surprised and felt so safe that at a moments notice she came over and had my baby delivered safely at 2.43am. God helped me deliver a beautiful baby boy. Both my husband and I and our families are filled with so much of joy and have a deep respect for our doctor simply because of the way we were calm and confident as Dr. Manjula always encouraged and helped us be confidant in everything, every concern we might have she clarified it right away and never was tired with our questions . I really hope and pray that many more doctors like Dr. Manjula will rise and be a blessing to many individuals and their families. I would recommend no other doctor but Dr. Manjula, I am totally confident that she will do her best to instill hope in mothers like me and help them bring up a baby. What I looked for the most was to have a normal delivery and not go for cesarean, Dr. Manjula stands for normal delivery and only when it is unavoidable she goes for cesarean. Dr. Manjula right from the start prepared us mentally and always pushed us to go for normal despite the pain. We need doctors like this, as cesarean might ease the pain at the moment but women suffer with back pain lifelong. Dr. Manjula ensured we have a normal delivery and I am so happy today that God sent us such a wonderful doctor. I recommend Dr. Manjula at Cloudnine Hospital HRBR layout. Just one appointment with her and I assure you will not be disappointed. Truly words cannot contain the gratitude I have for Dr. Manjula but I will always remember her and her family in my prayers and always be grateful to her. Thank you Dr. Manjula for your amazing service, truly you are the best in your job! I will miss the regular visits, hopefully will see you soon for our second baby. Thank you so much Dr. Manjula. Best Wishes and Warm Regards from Lilly Sophia and Godwin.
reply_text: Thank you very much Sophia  and Godwin for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pre and Post Delivery Care,Pregnancy Tests,Pre-Pregnancy Counselling,Labor and Delivery,
review:
Hi All,

I will speak my heart out here. Me and my wife accidentally meet the doctor as my wife was having some gall bladder and Kidney stone problem. We consulted her as we are not sure if these problems create any problem if we decide to have a baby. She gave assurance that these will not create much problem. Also she recommended to visit Dr Shamna from Specialist hospital to get more clarity on this problem as it was not her expertise. Once Dr Shamna gave us a green signal to go ahead with Pregnancy. We again consult Dr Manjula for planning a baby. She explained everything  professionally.  And my wife conceived in next month . We are very happy that that finally we will be parent. But back of the head always the concern of having those stones lived. After 3 month of pregnancy we got another bad news that she got diabetes . She put her into strict diet. and ask us to monitor the sugar level. It gone till 6 month but her sugar was not coming to the level. Then she refer to endocrinologist Dr Binutha Reddy from Cloud nine hospital . She suggested to start taking insulin and explained the complication during delivery because of sugar. Then I started searching about the effects of diabetes during pregnancy . And I found that baby normally gain weights due to high insulin level and because of that normal delivery is not possible. I discussed with my father also. He suggested that in big hospital they always prefer C- section over normal delivery. So he suggested to come to our village and said at least will try normal delivery in our home town. I discussed these things with doctor and she gave me assurance that she will try her level best to do normal delivery. She only asked to maintain the sugar level. Then we thought to take insulin 4 times a day and also monitor the sugar level 4 times a day. In our last scan we got to know that the baby wight is normal and we were happy that the hard work paid off. Finally the day has come and we got admitted to hospital. All the nursing staff along with Dr Alka was really supportive on the day. As doctor promised she done a normal delivery and we are blessed with a baby girl. the most beautiful  gift of our life gave by Dr Manjula. Thank you doctor thank you very much for all your support.

Above all what really touched my heart about doctor was , In our discharge date while i was discussing with her she told us to  pray that everyone will have normal delivery. This explains her altitude towards her work.

1) She is very professional
2) She remember all her patients and there  details by heart,
3) Always approachable in phone as well
4) Very friendly and behave like a elder sister.
5) She prefers household solution over medication for common problems during pregnancy which I really like.
6) She always give confidence to the patients.


I recommend everyone to visit the doctor if you are planning a baby and I am pretty sure you will not regret and happy through out the life.
reply_text: Thankyou Manoj and Mamatha for those kind words it means a lot for me

tags: None
review: This review was long due... I and my wife were looking for a good gynecologist after visiting 3 gynecologist we visited her for pre pregnancy consultation and pcod... Unlike our previous experience with other doctors... Dr. Manjula made us very comfortable in the first consultation itself. She patiently listened to us and answered all our queries... She gave us her phone number in the first visit itself and said text me if you have more questions... I have never met a doctor who is so friendly and approachable... We still remember she told us taking care of pcod is my problem so don't worry about it... She explained us everything one needs to know about pregnancy and within a month we were expecting... First 3 Months were little difficult for my wife with excessive nausea and hyper acidity but the doctor took very good care of my wife.. we even have to rush my wife to emergency once at midnight and she picked up the phone and asked to take my wife to hospital and before we reached there she had called up the on duty doctor and already breifed them about what treatment needs to be done.this shows how much she cares for her patients.. while the on duty doctor was insisting on getting admitted She told there is no need to get admitted... She would never suggest any test for the sake of doing it. What we really liked is that unlike other doctors she would only suggest test and scans if necessary.. and doesn't make her patients spend extra money...this is rare in Bangalore... After 3 Months my wife's pregnancy was cakewalk... We followed every instruction the doctor gave and my wife was active and worked till the last day... She advised us on diet plan as well as exercises and this helped my wife the most she was fit and walked to the labor room smiling at 6 cm dialation.. at 37 weeks we went for regular check up my wife said the baby movements have decreased she checked and said my wife is already in labour.. she asked us to go home and notice the contractions.. she kept messaging my wife to check on her and called her to clinic in evening to check her again where we learned that my wife is 6 cm dialation already but she did not have intolerable pains.. she asked us to reach hospital and said she would be there in 2 hours and we will have our baby by 9 pm.. we reached hospital at 6:30 pm and my baby girl was born by 8:50 on my wife had such a short labor all because of Dr Manjula. She insisted throughout the pregnancy on eating dates to ease labor and doing exercises and this helped my wife a lot.. while many elders told us not to eat dates my wife followed what Dr said and she had dates since 5 th month.. another thing I would like to highlight is that even while we were at hospital in labour room Dr Manjula was available on the phone I was in constant touch with her.. usually from what I have heard from friends is that the gynecologist will be in touch with on duty doctor and would only rely on the information they give and they don't pick up the call from family members while the patient is in labour room.. but she would pick up the phone and was constantly in touch.. she came before the time and made my wife feel comfortable... My wife could walk next day of the delivery.. no one could tell by seeing my wife that she had delivered last night she was so active the next day itself.. I can not thank Dr Manjula enough for all her efforts... *** ** ** *** *** **** ****** *** *** ****** Even after discharge my kid had jaundice and we had to admit her again for treatment.. Dr saw my mother in law in lobby and came to ask why are we in hospital.. she also kept asking about my baby's health, she went out of her way to ensure my baby is getting right treatment by checking with other doctors as my girl's jaundice was prolonged for more than 2 weeks. Now we wish she was a pediatrician too... ** **** ***** **** *** *** **** ****** ** *** ******** It's very rare to find a doctor who is not only good at her job but is also down to earth, approachable and friendly... Despite being so busy she would always come and talk to her patients if she sees them somewhere. Rest assured if you are her patient you don't have to worry about anything.. she will take care of everything... We really thank our stars that we met her and our journey of pregnancy was so memorable all coz of her.

review:
I am fortunate to have had Dr. Manjula Deepak as Gynaec specialist for my wife. Way back in 2018-19, 5 Years back she had helped us to become proud parents of our sweet and beloved little princess. She has helped us become parents for the second time now that too with twins. Thanks to Dr. Manjula for her demonstration of due diligence and her guidance towards our successful and most memorable phase of attaining parenthood. We are now blessed with twin baby boys both in their best of health and weight. She is awesome as a doctor, especially in placing the right focus on each of her patients. Surprisingly, as not to be seen in most of the doctors, she diligently remembers each detail of the health conditions of her patients, their medications, their allergies and follow-up dates, etc. Apart from a great doctor, Dr. Manjula is a great soul as well who aims at serving the society with her best possible efforts and capacity. She is right there when there is a need may it be any part of the  midnight or day time. Really perplexed to see the way she manages between her consultations and delivery cases effectively without injustice to either. She visits the scan rooms personally many times to ensure proper understanding on the case. Also, I would not forget mentioning the way she explains and encourages her patients to make them aware of some of the treatments/procedures like cervical encirclage etc and helps take right decisions during the course of pregnancy - Only to ensure the best for her patients.  This, to a great extent helps towards the very high success rates that she delivers. Another great thing that we have noticed in Dr. Manjula 
 is the result-oriented & efficient planning that she does. I am grateful to the Almighty God that he connected us with this awesome doctor. She is also available on messaging apps/platforms for quick doubts/clarifications, which is one of the greatest assets of consulting with her.

Overall, I would definitely suggest/insist my friends/colleagues to Dr. Manjula Deepak without a second choice !

Along with Dr. Manju Deepak, I am thankful to cloudnine & the staff who stood with us in every step to ensure that we achieve parent-hood gracefully !!

All The Best and may God bless you,
TRS & Uzma

review: In today‚Äôs life it doesn‚Äôt sounds good if we call medical science ‚Äì a service. It is purely the most profitable business across the globe. Maybe for this reason, in our journey towards parenthood; most of the doctors just looked either like a high-class business professional‚Äôs or highly talented ‚ÄòMedical Engineers‚Äô. For me these Medical Engineers looks like a perfect doctor only when they add that additional component of Magical touch. Dr. Manjula Deepak is one such doctor that we met in our life, words can‚Äôt just describe her way of treatment. Because it‚Äôs not just about the treatment, it is something beyond her work. I could say - a great relationship that she builds-up, the trust that she develops in, her activeness that encourages patient and the smile which takes all the burden and worries out of the patient. Seeing such doctors, I still believe that the medical science remained as the priceless service on this planet. My wife had just completed 3 months of her pregnancy when we decided to change the doctor/hospital due to traveling time (which is more obvious in Bangalore) and family concerns. Finally, we have decided to consult in Couldnine because of its huge network spread across Bangalore. I found Dr. Manjula Deepak‚Äôs profile on Practo and the feedback given about her treatment just amazed me. I asked my wife to let‚Äôs try once before finalizing the doctor for the rest of pregnancy treatment and labor. My wife agreed and then we met Dr. Manjula. What to say about that first visit? Awesome, she impressed both of us in first ever visit. I should thank Practo for making this to happen. The way she calls the patient‚Äôs name, the way she interacts with the patient and her family, the courage that she initiates in the patient everything just delights us. Soon after that first visit my wife said I will continue with Dr. Manjula and then the relationship between the doctor and the patient has begun. For my wife, Dr. Manjula is more like a family member, just like her elder sister. Dr. Manjula made the journey of pregnancy very simple and most memorable one. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
*****"An Angel was born in our life with the blessings of an Angel"******

Hi all,
We visited Manjula mam after 3 abortions, which used to happen within 2‚Äì3 months of conceiving. We went with our friend's reference, but we were having not even 10% of confidence of giving birth to a child, but she has (Manjula Mam). 
First thing she did was cutting off all overdosed medicines which my wife use to take (obviously suggested by other doctors) and bring down it to one tablet that is Folic. Guess what, very next month my wife conceived naturally without any external medical aid.
We went to Manjula madam, and she was very cautious at our initial stages till we complete 3 months. But let me tell you one thing, there were no extra medicines given to my wife except madam giving us confidence (She used to tell us nothing is going to happen until she is there for us).
Yes, Finally we completed 38 Weeks, that too without any overdosed medicines and steroids.
Guess what, My wife gave birth to a beautiful little angel on March 3rd which we never expected in our dreams also.(That too normal delivery)
The best part about Manjula madam is she is confident and very patient to listen to you, at the same time she expects you to listen to her and follow what she says. 
Sometimes she might be rude when you gain extra weight or when you increase your blood sugar level, but this is all about her concern about you.
She prefers doing normal delivery and never ever force you, or you force her for C-Section (My wife bore 12 Hours of labor pain, but Madam was very confident that she is going to make it as normal one, now we are realizing the Importance of normal delivery in our postnatal).
Finally, I can say thanks to madam for making us parents which we never dreamed of.

context: Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pregnancy Tests,Complicated Pregnancy Treatment,Labor and Delivery,
review:
I don't know where to start with.Its been 3 years of journey with Dr.Manjula Deepak.She is very friendly and humble person i have ever known.I first met doctor at Hrbr layout clinic for my first pregnancy.During scanning radiologist told that I have a bicornuate uterus.When you Google about that it's all scary stories.But doctor told us not to believe all that and shared some success stories.
 Later even when i had three miscarriages doctor never gaveup  on us.
Me and my husband lost the confidence after 3 miscarriages and asked for some fertility treatment but Ma'am would always give us positive energy and never made us to spend unnecessarily through out.
Finally I got positive without any treatment.My fourth pregnancy wasn't an easy one though.At 28th week i was advised to be on complete bedrest due to cervical incompetency.She pushed it till 36th week.Since i was on bedrest for almost 8 weeks i didn't have the confidence of normal delivery.Infact me and my husband asked for Csection on 37th week but doctor told me that she has confidence in me and won't do C section unnecessarily.She told me to get admitted on September16th at 9 pm.She started inducing pain and waited till next day morning.But my cervix didn't get dilated more then 4cm.Finally on September 17th with doctor's motivation i delivered our little princess at 11.28 am and it was a normal delivery.
Without Manjula ma'am it wouldn't have been possible.She is truly an angel in our lives:)she is not only a doctor to us she is more than that now:)Me and my husband would like to thank her for being there for us through out this journey though words are not enough to praise her for her dedication and sincerity:)I would strongly recommend her.Thank you for everything ma'am:)

review: I'm Preethi, 27years old,married for the last 2+ years, I was diagnosed with a huge fundal fiberroid in February 2016 by Lalitha Bhaskar,  who said conceiving would be really tuff and suggested a myomectomy! In the course of preparation for the surgery I was hopeless of having a child.. by the grace of God, I was God willingly conceived in the month of April 2016 which I was not aware till June 2016.. Just by the force of elders I was asked to do a pregnancy test, and it was positive.. for confirmation I had to go meet a gynaecologist to know what was to be done with such a complicated pregnancy.. I met Doctor Manjula Deepak at Cloudnine Bangalore in June 2016 to get a confirmation on my risky pregnancy and about the future progress.. * **** *** * ***** *** ** *** ** ***** Amidst having a huge fundal fibrroid I was 11 weeks pregnant.. I am obese and was also diagnosed with Diabetes, hypertension, thyroid, was exposed to x-ray while pregnant and was unaware.. It was doctor Manjula who gave me hope to continue with the pregnancy without worrying about the risk factors.. it was doctor Manjula who treated and guided me throughout my pregnancy.. Being so supportive enough whether it was day or night helping me cope with all my queries *** ****** ** *** **** ** **********. I had also taken a second opinion from a different gynaecologist about my pregnancy but was asked to drop my pregnancy at 11weeks as it would harm me due to the fiberroid.. I clinged to doctor Manjula and was full of positive vibes .. amidst all these risks factors Doctor helped me have the life's greatest blessing of having a child with normal delivery which was impossible with a fibrroid.. but doctor Manjula had the zeal in her to get me delivered normally.. I am blessed with a baby boy.. I would strongly recommend doctor Manjula Deepak ** *** ** *** *** ******* ** **** who would sail you through any kind of complications in pregnancy.. I would like to thank you for all the support and care you showed to me doctor.. Our lifetime gratitude to you doctor..

review:
Few words and few sentences to write would not be enough to explain our feelings for such a great human being (Dr. Manjula Deepak). 
She is a positive soul with a beautiful smile. She is humble, energetic, extremely down to earth, very caring and friendly person.
A great Doctor like her doesn't need any feedback. Below are the experiences that we had during the 9 months of Pregnancy.

Thanks to the Practo for the great reviews , we decided to visit Cloudnine HRBR to consult Dr. Manjula (Assuming we can utilize our Health Insurance with Cloudnine)

We visited her for Pregancy consultation as my wife had Chronic Hypertension (High BP) prior pregnancy as well , Initially I was
very scared due to my wife health problems , child should not have any impact.

From the very first day of consultation we were guided towards the right direction & later we felt very secured and confident
that we are in the right hand. My wife pregnancy was not a cake walk for her as she had a lots of complications in the second half of pregnancy
but we never lost hope because of Mam (Dr. Manjula Deepak). Whenever we used to see her face my wife used to feel relaxed (Looking at her whatsup DP as well :).

We used to believe "now Mam is here and she will do what is best for us". We used to wait eagerly for our visit so that we can meet her 
because we always used to get a positive energy after meeting her, my mind used to get relaxed when we stepped out of her chamber. 
Whenever she had any health issues through out her pregnancy mam was always available on whatsup and responded immediately to the queries. 

One thing what we understood is that one has to trust her when being treated by her and then you are in the best hands. She is very friendly and understands the issue. (Remember our insurance provider was not covered under Cloudnine HRBR which we knew during the 1st month 
and still went ahead with consultation as we knew we are in a great hand.. God bless Manjula for getting our Smile and Mojo Back)

We got blessed with a baby Boy and he is of 2 weeks.

We will always pray to Almighty for your well-being.

Khushboo-Shailendra & our lovely Kid Atharv.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pre and Post Delivery Care,Labor and Delivery,Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy,
review:
We (Wife & Me) visited Dr. Manjula Deepak after being highly recommended by one of our friends, and also after reviewing her on Practo. It was one of the best decisions of our life.
Not only did Dr. Manjula meet our expectation, but went above and beyond. We visited her from Day 1 and stuck to her till the day the baby was born and consulted her even for post pregnancy care.
From Day 1 Dr. Manjula looked after us like we were her family, she acclimated to us very well and made us feel comfortable right from the get go.
We visited her multiple times throughout our pregnancy journey, and each time after the meet we walked away with greater confidence & repose.

We were hellbent on getting a normal delivery and had stated that to the doctor on the very first day as well, the doctor asked us to rest easy and not worry about the delivery now and just to pay attention on the mother and Fetus.
Ultimately the result was a Normal Delivery, led by the very capable hands of Dr. Manjula Deepak :)
The labor for my wife was a long and strenuous one, it lasted for around 16 Hours, there was a scare of going to C Section as well, apart from that there was a condition called "Caput" for my Baby (Where the baby's head gets elongated because the baby has been stuck in the vaginal cavity for long). Though all these complication & Obstacles, Dr. Manjula helped us deliver the baby through Normal Vaginal Delivery, a tremendous feat !!!

If i had to describe Dr. Manjula Deepak through a few adjectives, they would be - 
1. Uber Responsible
2. Ferociously Passionate 
3. Fervently Energetic
4. Work ethic of an Ox
5. Acute Knowledge & expertise
6. Affable, Approachable & always Available for her patients (24/7 by Whats App)
7. An earnest personality

When it is all said and done, we only have the fondest of memories and deepest of respect towards Dr. Manjula Deepak, she really is a Godsend ! 

If we were to ever plan for another baby, I would love for Dr. Manjula Deepak to be our Doctor again.

And for people looking to choose a Doctor to walk them through their Pregnancy Journey, Look no further - I would suggest Dr. Manjula Deepak 100%.

PS -Thank you Dr. Manjula Deepak for showing your love, dedication & Hard work in helping us getting our beautiful son to this world :)

Thanks,
Ajay Ravinder & Ramya Gopal

This was my first pregnancy and consulted nearby gynac(which was recommended by our neighbour). Without much research we just went in. Had to write down the older experience, coz you were completely opposite and never let us down. First meet with her, and it was like 'oh god! Why did i not check on her before'. Better late than never. every meet with her, we gained so much knowledge. Being first time pregnant, all my silliest questions was answered. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnant Women Counseling,Maternal Care/ Checkup,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
It's a very late review [delivered in Nov'19 :-)] but I really didn't wanted to not post it for such an amazing doctor. 

We came to know about Manjula Deepak along with few other doctors, while we were browsing through good gynos nearby. However, were confused of which doctor to choose, somehow we gave it a go to meet Dr. Manjula Deepak, purely by looking at the reviews on Practo. 
But the day we met her, myself and my husband both were super impressed with her friendliness and the way she explained  everything. No confusion from there, decided to stick to her till the delivery.
Things which impressed us is, when we informed the doc about the travelling plan (when I was in my 6th week) which was planned well before conceiving, she did agree to it but proactively did the scan to check my sack. Also a scan was done by her upon my return too, to see if everything is fine.. And there are many such instances..
Almost at the end of my pregnancy, that's when I was in my 38th week, the scan did show that the baby's weight is little more than the average Indian babies. She immediately took the call to go for delivery in the same week, so as to try best for vaginal birth, since I had no complications and active throughout. 
The day I got admitted to the hospital, it was 10PM and there she was just in 15mins to check me. She was available at 4 in the morning over the call. Again by 7AM in the hospital to check her admitted patients (to be mom's). 
And there again by 9AM for her regular OPD and deliveries. I was awestruck to see the same enthusiasm throughout. 
Finally, we gave up on normal and took a call to go with C-Sec, there was my boy with 3 rounds of cord around his neck. 
If she hadn't adviced on the 38th week and if we were waiting for another 2 weeks for the delivery, have no idea how the situation would've turned out to be. My boy came out safe and all healthy. All thanks to the doctor. 
She is truly an angel, in my mom's words "Devathe" :-) 

This is from Vidhya and Harsha -Thank you very much doctor and sorry about the delayed review, typing it at 5 in the morning as my days are super busy with the kiddoüôÇ
reply_text: Thank you very much Vidhya and Harsha for your kind words it means a lot to me

review:
** ******* ****** ** *** **** *******
I visited her the first time during 2month of pregnancy. I had previous history of missed abortion so i was very skeptical and scared.
I still remember; after the first visit i was so impressed with her that i was 101% sure that she was the doctor for me. The reson for this surety: her amicable nature and the patience with which she listens to your problems and her treatment speaks measures about her expertise in her field.
I have had a rough pregnancy period: from early gestational diabetes to chicken pox in second trimester to cervix incompetence in third trimester; but dr manjula was always there to calm me *** **** ** *** **** ********* ********. For cervix incompetence i had to undergo surgery to put shirodkar stiches. I called dr. Around 5 pm about the ultra sound report for cervix incompetence and she quickly asked me to get hospitalized at cloudnine hospital. She came rushing to the hospital at 9 pm and performed the procedure at 11 pm. 
My husband was out of country at that time but i did not feel slightest fear or doubt about this operation because of my trust and confidence in dr manjula.
I still remeber when i had chicken pox; i was really scared about its affects on baby. I had googled a lot about it to worry me enough to have sleepless nights. When i reached to dr manjula about my fears and worries she explained me the consequence and measures so well that it calmed me down. It was the trust that she has built up that i was relieved immediately.
There were so many complications in my pregnancy that any other dr would have optd for c section. But dr manjula assured me that she will try her level best for normal delivery and if it doesnt works she will go for c section. On D day dr induced labour around 11 pm and we were anticipating that i will go into labour around 7-8 am in morning.
 But everything happened fast and my water broke around 5 am. Dr manjula was immediately informed and in no time she rushed to hospital. As soon as i saw her i took a sigh of releif that my savoiur has come. I gave birth to a healthy baby boy.
Me and my family are so thankful to dr manjula. My normal delivery was only possible because of her.
I strongly recommend dr manjula as ahe will make your pregnancy journey easy and memorable one.

We are grateful to you dr.
Wish you all the success and good luck in life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnancy care and management,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
I was fortunate to have had Dr. Manjula Deepak as my obstetrician. I consulted Dr. Manjula after my sister recommended her with great zeal. And that's the best decision I took during this journey of motherhood. Especially after being a victim of poor support from my earlier obstetrician. I had GST my sugar readings were erratic. My first encounter with Dr. Manjula filled me with hope, confidence and peace. She approached my case with positivity ; very skillfully addressed the immediate GST problem by connecting me to an endocrinologist. ***** **** ************** gave a download on how the next months going to shape if I follow the specifics given by her. I have a paranoia to even syringes, never thought of normal delivery as an option but she mentally prepared me for normal delivery talking about it at ease from our first meeting. She gave ample time and answered our questions even if they are trivial (sometimes even to chat or joke lightly which I haven't noticed generally in doctors). She spoke to my husband and prepped him on what/how his actions will help and impact me during pregnancy and delivery. She was always available which was such a luxury to have from your doctor, I would reach out to her and she would respond to calls or texts the same day.
My delivery day Dr. Manjula was present to check on me regularly. tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Ours was a High risk pregnancy as we had three miscarriages in the past. After a blighted ovum, full term IUD and 24 week miscarriage, my wife conceived again. We are happy and also in total dilemma of which doctor to consult this time, as we have already consulted a couple of doctors in the previous pregnancies. Ours is a critical case as the cause of the previous miscarriages were not known. As per our understanding, new doctors may not have the expertise to deal with our case and the senior doctors have less time to have personal attention and connect with our concerns and queries to take care of the minute details.

Fortunately, we had this doctor recommended by a known reference. During our first visit itself, we knew that we are with the right doctor when she explained the process that she would follow through this pregnancy and her expertise and confidence in understanding our case helped us to trust in her which we didn't get it from any other doctor so far we consulted. A plan was charted and we just followed through the plan and put our confidence in her. Though it involved in precautionary medical procedures and protocols when are bit strenuous and necessary to have safe delivery, all those were wiped out with the positive vibes and friendly talk she does which eases out all doubts and lights up the confidence in us. She is reachable in need which helped us to clarify all the concerns we had even the minute ones and she took personal attention and care towards us and helped us to handle things efficiently and encouraged us through out the pregnancy.

We had a lot of hurdles to cross through out this pregnancy including precautionary cervical stitch, sugars going up and down, baby in breach position but with the timely decisions the doctor took and her right instincts helped us finally to have a healthy baby girl delivered safely on 19th May 2017. We cannot express our gratitude of thanks to her for giving us the first baby despite all odds. We sincerely recommend her to all who are looking for a good and friendly doctor with professional expertise.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I have consulted with Dr Manjula Deepak for a period of almost a year. Started with pre-pregnancy consultation and the doctor saw me through all the way till I delivered my twins last month.

Dr Manjula is one of the most friendly and reassuring doctors that I have consulted with. Her cheery attitude and confidence are very comforting. With a twin pregnancy, I started off being very scared - both about how my body would handle it and for the wellbeing of the babies. The doctor was extremely reassuring at all times. She never prescribed excessive medicines. In fact, she discouraged me from getting unnecessary scans / tests and stuck to fairly simple ground rules for the entire pregnancy. Unlike in a number of other twin pregnancy stories I have heard, she permitted me to travel in my second trimester and encouraged me to remain active through most of my pregnancy. She always set realistic expectations. What could otherwise have been a challenging time was made much easier because of her approach. 

The doctor spent a considerable amount of time during each consultation explaining matters well and going over scans with us carefully. She usually preempted most questions we had and was always available on phone for any follow up doubts / problems I had. On two occasions, she rushed to the hospital because I was facing discomfort - on the second occasion, she delivered my beautiful twins :) 

Even with the decision of whether to go for a natural delivery of a c-section, and during the actual surgery, the doctor was very informative and caring. This went a long way in making me feel comfortable and in control. One instance is that right before I was taken for the surgery, she remembered that I was very scared of injections and asked the anesthetist to personally insert the tube for the IV so that I would be caused minimal pain and discomfort.  It made me feel like I was in very good hands - which I certainly was!

I am extremely grateful to the doctor for her support. Most of all, since I have a tendency to stress a lot, it really helped that she balanced it off with her reassuring and kind approach. I recommend the doctor highly.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We visited Dr. Manjula Deepak during my wife's pregnancy and I must admit that she was no less than a blessing in our lives. In January 2020, my wife was pregnant and we were overwhelmed with the news, we were all happy until she was 12 weeks after a few blood tests (double marker) the doctors from other hospitals informed us that the test shows high risk (Its high level is indicative to a higher risk of Trisomy 18 and Down's syndrome) unfortunately all this was happening during the pandemic and the lockdown. I and my wife visited more than 3 to 4 hospitals and every time it was disappointing. few doctors also advised us to abort and to not take any chances that is when we were introduced to DR Manjula Deepak through my wife's friend. The first day we met her we realized we were in right place and the safe hands. Oh my god, what a personality i have never seen a doctor like her in my life and I am not exaggerating the passion she has towards her profession, the way she communicates with her patients, the confidence she gives to the family members of the patients. she is available round the clock and you can ask her any doubts any time she answers it without losing her cool. She took us through the entire pregnancy with such ease. then came the labor time my wife was admitted to the hospital at 10 pm she was home at that time I was surprised to see her in the hospital at 11 pm and she was just around and finally after almost 10 hours I was all tired but again to my surprise she made sure by 9.33 am my wife had a normal delivery and we welcomed a baby girl. I can go on and on about this wonderful human being but I have kept things short. I am recommending Dr. Munjala Deepak to others with 100% confidence and am sure she is going to be a blessing in your lives that we can guarantee from our own experience. here I am thanking her once again for changing our lives.Thanking you and will always be grateful   Sandeep Ramachandran    Gayathri Priyanka

review:
Dr.Manjula is truly a God sent gift to the field of gynaecology and I can say this with 1000% confidence. My wife and I started visiting Dr.Manjula since the beginning of our pregnancy. She is a representative of kindness, friendliness, compassion, love and care and goes all her way out to put her patients at ease. 
She is someone who is available at anytime, on call, whatsapp and personally to counsel her patients. In our case, my wife had a bleeding in the early weeks of her pregnancy, and Dr.Manjula ensured we were tension free and safeguarded the health of both my wife and our baby. At every point, she would give us information before hand about what to expect, which made us well prepared for the situation. In our case, my wife had a water break at home, and we were totally panicking. Just a call to Dr.Manjula, and she ensured things happened smoothly. She had already instructed the labour section about our coming, and once we were there, she ensured she arrived in no time(though her presence at that moment was actually not needed), just to comfort us. Also, from the day 1, she prepared my wife for a normal delivery by guiding her with basic exercises and diet, and the result was a normal vaginal delivery. It was late night when my wife was suffering with labour pain, and I was in total pain too seeing her suffer. I requested Dr.Manjula to go for C-section, so that it would ease my wife's pain. However, even in such a situation, she calmed me down, counseled me and brought out our beautiful angel into this world. 

Thank you is a very small word to describe what Dr.Manjula has done for us. We are ever thankful to you and God bless you and your family. Anyone who wants to experience a tension free pregnancy journey just needs to visit Dr.Manjula.

review:
Dr.Manjula came into our lives as a God sent gift. She is a representative of humanity, approachability, friendliness and kindness in treating her patients. My personal experience about doctors made me very apprehensive about the entire fraternity, but she proved otherwise. She knows what each of her patients wants and approaches each of them with a personal touch.

My wife was pregnant with PCOD and she ensured to instill confidence in us and pushed us for a normal delivery. In the first few weeks of pregnancy, my wife started bleeding but she was very calm and ensured that the child was safe and healthy. We had to go through a lot of emotional tension due to the covid situation, but she was always there at any time, be it on call, WhatsApp or personally to counsel and guide us. She answers even the silliest of questions with so much patience, and understands the patient from a motherly perspective. 
Our labour was unexpected since my wife's water broke at home. She immediately responded by coming to the hospital on that day, though it was a holiday, and the procedure could've been initiated by the duty doctor. At my request, she came in and instilled confidence in us. I was unable to see my wife undergo so much pain and called her requesting for a C-section. She calmed me down in this situation and ran in to the delivery room at the odd hour and made the normal vaginal delivery possible. 
Also, a special mention needs to be made about her post pregnancy care. She will be there for you even after delivery and guide you like an elder sister. ln my opinion, Dr.Manjula is an asset not just for Cloud nine hospital but to the entire medical fraternity. God bless her and her family always. She's truly a gem and words fall short to express our gratitude to her. We are lucky to know her and be associated with her. 

Raghu, Mala and our little one.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,
review:
I had researched Dr Manjula online as being a doctor who focuses on diet, exercise and natural remedies during pregnancy and she was nearby, which is why we chose to go to her from the first trimester itself! And she certainly lived up to that, giving natural solutions where possible and avoiding medication unnecessarily while helping me stay active during pregnancy!

It was controversial in my family when we chose to go to her instead of the usual doctor family members go to in Manipal, but I'm so glad we did, as our experience was way better than some of the stories we'd heard of about other doctors. Later, I heard that people come from far to visit her and now I understand why and having gone through my entire pregnancy, delivery and recovery with her, with such good experience, I probably will travel any distance for her to be my OB as well :)

Dr Manjula is a ball of energy! In the initial consultations, I found her too fast, though she never rushed us. Even if we forgot to ask her anything, she was always prompt, although not very verbose in answering on whatsapp, giving clear answer to what needs to be done. It's not just her high energy and positivity which made an impression, it was great to hear that she was in CMC Vellore and also to hear positive reviews from other doctors about her! 

My labour was really long and hard and during delivery, we saw that she was certainly very skilled and knowledgeable in various induction and delivery options, aims for least intervention possible, gives you the time needed, explains options and allows you to decide, doesn't rush there either and is adept at performing different procedures too! 

As I write this, it has been one and a half months since we delivered our baby and it was a very smooth journey from the frist trimester to delivery, to recovery now and only because of Dr Manjula's expert guidance and execution! Thanks doc!

I always felt OBs get great reviews online, can they be trusted? though after my almost year long interaction, I'd say this one certainly deserves all her glowing reviews and more! :)

review:
I started consulting Dr Manjula Deepak from the 6th week of my pregnancy . She came highly recommended by people living around in North Bangalore . 
During my first trimester - i was nauseous all the time , puking multiple times in a day and dead tired . To add to that I had a bad bout of fever but Dr Manjula was always quick to respond on whatsapp with remedies . The only thing I looked forward to in my first trimester was waiting outside her consultation room to be called in  . If you ask any of her past or current patients they will tell you how she has a distinct warm way of calling out your name. She is such a positive force that for the duration of the consultation you would forget any pain and discomfort. 
I have always been super active , so my biggest concern was that I wouldn‚Äôt be able to do so during my pregnancy . All my worries disappeared when I met her - she ensured that I had a normal and healthy pregnancy (dispelling a lot of myths regarding food and exercises ) . I was able to continue running after my first trimester right up until the day I delivered . I wholeheartedly thank Dr Manjula for instilling that confidence in me to continue . 

Lastly my family was always quite keen on ensuring that I have a normal vaginal delivery . Dr Manjula recommended exercises throughout my pregnancy and kept monitoring the scans in the last few weeks to ensure that we push for a vaginal delivery as much as possible . So you can imagine how elated we were when I delivered a baby boy vaginally after a labour of just 5 hours . 

There are so many such wonderful instances that my family and I have shared with Dr Manjula Deepak - from the bottom of our hearts we thank you for all your support and guidance and want to tell you that we love you üòä(This space is too small to express our gratitude üôè)

review:
I would like to thank Dr Manjula Deepak mam for helping me and my bundle of joy.
I decided to visit Dr Manjula mam after seeing so many positive reviews in Practo.
I was new to Bangalore and was worried to which doctor to show my pregnancy in Bangalore.
With my first meet with Dr Manjula mam itself, I was very confident and comfortable with mam.
Dr mam kept us in ease and mam was very friendly with us. Mam used to answer even our simplest and silly questions with a smile .
Mam was available even in the odd hours like morning  4 am and night 11 pm and so on . I contacted mam when I had an emergency during my labour .
I had severe back ache and my water broke in 36 weeks. I was in emergency and called mam in odd hours . Mam was always available for our questions and support.
My labour was also very pleasant experience because of Dr Manjula mam. She kept me very comfortable during my delivery.  I delivered a baby boy Via C-section on June 13th, 2020. Her soothing voice gave me confidence during my delivery .  I have completely recovered and got discharged in 3 days from hospital and now I am spending happy time with my bundle of joy at my home .

This is my second delivery and I should say this time I had a pleasant pregnancy support and delivery compared to my previous delivery which was also C-section which happened 7 years ago in Chennai in different hospital.

I strongly recommend Dr Manjula Deepak mam. 
Dr Manjula Deepak mam is such a hard working, determined doctor I have ever seen who loves to serve people. Mam is always cheerful and greets us with smile .

Thank you again Dr Manjula Deepak mam for bringing happiness and joy in our family .

review:
I am writing this review as i want it to be helpful for others and share my experience.

Its very hard that you can find a human in this decade who can understand your pain, difficulties and never lets you down. Here comes Manjula mam, who is a paragon of empathy and positive energy. There is a saying that God sometimes lives in the form humans and she is one perfect example for it. I am surely not praising her high, its all the good attributes which requires a strong applause and you will notice all this if you ever got to visit her.

Let me just narrate how she bestowed happiness in to our family. I took my sister to Manjula mam after looking at all positive reviews on Practo( I did not miss even a single review) and did not mind travelling for one hour to meet such efficient doctor. My sister was in complete depression due to her previous pregnancy, where she lost her twins due to preterm delivery in 24 weeks due to complete negligence by previous doctors( Its not easy even for the family members as it took away my complete family happiness). During the first meet itself doctor was able to completely understand the mental status that my sister would be in and gave complete confidence to my sister just like a family member would do. Even the silliest questions where answered without any denial and this made my sister believe that she will be there at any time to help. From the time she conceived and till delivery her emotions were running high and it was Manjula mam who was able to calmly answer all her questions and give her the much required confidence. I don't think anyone else could even do this with much patience. Now my sister got blessed with a Baby boy and it was completely because this time it was God send angel Manjula mam who took care of my sister. I still remember her words " This is my responsibility to give your baby healthy in your hand and will not let a single seed unturned" and she did it.


Thank you Doctor and I wish the very best for you and your family in all aspects of life. I will be definitely recommending Manjula man to all my friends.

Shankar( Malini's Brother)

review:
Visited for pregnancy check up... 
     It's been  a month of my delivery...No words to talk about Dr Manjula deepak mam. She is so friendly and take care of each patient very personally and still remember the condition of every patient.
     When I was 2 months pregnant I had bleeding problem and visited X hospital with one of the doctor instead of consoling or treating she was scolding treated me so badly in my first visit itself I was thinking OMG till 9 months should I visit this doctor.Done with scan and blood test with much difficulty and duty doctor told me that I have gestational diabetes and suggested to come in morning and doctor will start insulin.I was shocked and confused and without second thought she want to start insulin, then me and my husband decided to take an another opinion
  
     we started searching for an another doctor and one of my friend suggested Dr Manjula Deepak mam.... In my first visit manjula madam spoke so nicely and gave so much confidence that no need of insulin and can be controlled through proper diet. I was having both hypertension and gestational diabetes. During my first visit with Mam I felt so good and felt am in safe hands.Mam explained my health condition very clearly made me feel relaxed and gave confident. In every visit mam took care of me so nicely... After 8th month my BP started fluctuating day by day but doctor has given an indication about this in prior to me and my husband and to follow just the instructions given. After 35week every week Mam told to visit frequently and in 36week my bp was getting high n fluid was very low. Next day early morning I got slight pain and messaged mam... Mam asked me to come immediately to hospital and when we reached hospital mam also came immediately and pains started getting more and within two hour delivered my Lil princess. In spite of my health conditions and complications during my pregnancy Manjula Mam made it so easy and I had normal delivery.   Its a big story but worth writing it just because of Manjula Deepak mam

Those who are searching for good gynaecologist without single thought please consult Dr. Manjula deepak - Cloud Nine Hospital.

review: Me and my husband are so lucky to find a perfect gynaecologist "Manjula Deepak". before we consulted her, we consulted another gynaecologist and our experience with her was good but she recommended many unnecessary tests and finaly told us that you have PCOD problem and it's little difficult to get pregnant, we were disappointed with this and we tought to have a second opinion from other gynaecologist and looked out in( Practo )and found Dr Manjula Deepak. review: It was a very happy moment to know my wife was pregnant. As usual, I was doing online survey to find a **** doctor (gynecologist). I found Dr. Manjula mam on Practo. After reading some of the reviews, I thought they must be paid ones. But looking at the number of reviews, I was convinced that they are not. So, we decided to go ahead with Manjula mam, even though cashless insurance facility (for the medical insurance I had) was not available in that hospital.Before consulting Dr. Manjula for the first time, I had lots of questions in mind, which I listed down, so that I could ask her. We met the doctor and realized that all the review comments about her are really true. We felt as if we are talking to one of our friends, rather than doctor. She is such a friendly and nice person, having lots of patience to explain us each and everything. Her explanation covered all my questions and I didn't have to ask them. So we decided to stay with the same doctor and not to switch to anyone else.Meanwhile my wife had some problem in the early third month, which was putting her pregnancy under risk. Dr. Manjula mam monitored my wife's condition closely and solved the problem. She even shared her personal mobile number to contact her directly under any emergency. *** ****** ******* *********** *********** ****** ******** ** ** **** **** **** ******* *** ********* She was preparing my wife for normal delivery.Later my baby had some complications, which forced doctor to deliver the baby at 32 weeks. It was not a surprise for us, as doctor had explained us this situation and was monitoring from few weeks back. She wanted to keep the baby in the womb, as long as possible.My wife delivered a boy baby on 8th March 2020 and she is doing fine. Baby is still in intensive care unit, but he is also doing very good. Hopefully he will be discharged very soon.Thanks a lot Manjula mam for all the support, care and the courage you have given to us. You will be remembered always by me and my wife.-Bharath and Chaitra

review:
we went to Cloudnine HRBR without doing any research about which doctor to consult(This is how we usually do :) ). Hospital provided Manjula mam's appointment(we now feel really lucky for that). On our first meeting itself, she made us absolutely  relaxed with her friendliness and the way she explained things. She talked to us with such a positivity that we felt pregnancy can be made less stressful. When we left the hospital after the first visit, we decided to continue with Manjula mam for the rest of the pregnancy. I have seen my friends going to different doctors for second opinion and third opinion , we never had to do that at any point of time.

These are some of the things which really helped us-

1) she explain things very clearly. Most of our question which we prepared got answered before we ask.
2)Answers were very specific. if we ask whether we can do something, she  either say 'yes' or 'no'. This was most helpful as we have seen doctors confuse people by leaving a choice to the patient by saying pros and cons of our action. Here she had taken decisions for us and we just need to follow whatever she say.
3)Although she is very busy, she gave ample time for everyone and made sure we leave her room with clear state of mind.

Her importance was completely realized on the day of delivery. There was a duty doctor who made me totally panic saying there is some complication. Later I met Manjula mam and she said nothing to worry and delivered the baby in 15 minutes. I thanked God for sending us to the right doctor and I believe God deliver his wishes through doctor's hands.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I started visiting Dr.Manjula Deepak from my second trimester. I was impressed with my first visit . She is really friendly and patiently answers all our questions. She is always available on phone and instantly responds  to all our queries. She prefers natural home remedies instead of medicines. I had to get hospitalized due to severe head ache and fever at 16 weeks. Doctor was out of station for a conference. But she made sure I was in right hands and she even asked one of her friend who was a neuro to personally check me. After that all my consultations and scans went smooth. At 38 weeks check up, she checked my cervix and told me that it is closed tightly and advised some exercises which will induce labor naturally.  But those exercises did not help and even after a week, my cervix was still tightly closed. Doctor asked me to get admitted and she said she will be inducing the same day and if no progress by next day we had to go for a C-section. I was induced the same day I got admitted after which I was in pain from the cervical exam. The next day again she made sure she herself did the cervical exam and informed me that the gel did not work and that I need to undergo C-section. Finally she delivered my little angel at 8 am. After the delivery, she informed my family who was eagerly waiting outside to hear the good news. Also she made sure the nurses took the baby outside to show her to my family. Her positivity gave me strength to recover quickly . She was one of my greatest support during my pregnancy and I would like to thank her for everything.

Though late I could not stop myself from giving feedback on Dr. Manjula as there is no other way we could express our gratitude. Dr. Manjula is a very professional,  positive and an energetic person who gives her 100% in putting the health of the patient first. In a city like Bangalore, we were initially confused whom to consult for our pregnancy and it was much beyond luck that we ended up in chosing  treatment under Dr. Manjula. Right from day 1 it was a wonderful journey for us and we have no words to describe how it went well. She understands the patient's need,  clears whatever doubts we have and most importantly she is approachable at any given time. During each visit we were explained in depth about the status of growth and well being of the baby and me. In addition I was given the glimpse of the symptoms that I may expect in the upcoming days or weeks which actually reduced the anxiety when I really faced it. Unlike many other doctors who advise for unnecessary blood tests and check up, she always did only when necessary. She always encouraged me for a normal delivery.  It was good to be treated with professionalism and care. Her approach and treatment regimen made us feel that we were in safe hands. We never wanted to miss out on her treatment and so we did not even go to our maternal home for delivery during the 7th month as per our tradition. Dr. Manjula explained about the diet/calorie intake, exercise pattern throughout pregnancy which helped me to have a healthy weight gain for me and baby.  On the day of delivery, once I called her informed about the symptoms which I experienced she waited at the hospital during midnight, beyond her working hours to check on me. Under her care I was able to deliver a healthy active baby through a normal delivery in a very short delivery time compared to what I observed in my friend circle.  Her way of treating me was excellent with utmost professionalism. I received the best quality care and had a quick recovery phase. We as a couple really trusted her and our experience with her was awesome. Our princess is now 1.5 month old and we have no words to express our gratitude towards Dr. Manjula.

We as a couple strongly recommend her.

Dineesha & Anand
