context: Pre and Post Delivery Care,Pregnancy Check Up,
review: If you are planning for a baby, then I would blindly recommend  Dr. Manjula Deepak. I had many complications during my pregnancy but Dr. Manjula made my pregnancy journey so smooth that now I don't even remember the trobules during my pregnancy. Let me tell you my pregnancy story. Before planning our baby we visited another doctor and had some fertility tests. In those tests my AMH level came below normal and that doctor suggested us to plan as soon as possible. However, we were not ready and waited for 1 year at that time. When we thought of planning a baby, we visited cloud nine on April 2018 and guess what we got appointment with Dr. Manjula. She explained everything in detail and assured us that we should not worry about the fertility test for now and try naturally first. On May 15, we again met Dr. Manjula and this time with positive pregnancy test. She shared her number at that time. Since it was my first pregnancy, I had many queries which she used to answer patiently over messages or calls.  I must say she is 24*7 available for her patients which shows her commitment towards mothers and her passion towards her profession. After 45 days, I developed hypermesis gravidarum which is extreme nausea and vomiting. I used to vomit 20 times a day and nothing was staying in my stomach. That phase was difficult for me but I used to return with positive mind whenever I visited her. This went till 4th month of pregnancy. Later in the third trimester, I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes. Again, Dr. Manjula calmed me and motivated me to eat healthy. She negotiated that phase with me in cool and calm manner. Due to earlier complications and gestational diabetes, the growth of baby was sub-par, but Dr. Manjula delivered the baby on 25th December 2018 with no further hiccups. I still remember the moment when she told me "your little Santa is here..". She was thorough and professional in her approach which we admire. She was calm and composed and never let us panic. We would surely recommend her.

context: Pre and Post Delivery Care,Pregnancy,Laparoscopic Surgery (Obs & Gyn),
review:
I started consulting with Dr. Manjula in May 2017 for PCOS and excessive bleeding.  Through the course of the last 18 months, she has been right by my side for
- Recommending non-hormonal medication to help get pregnant
- Diagnosing that I had polyps and recommending a surgery to remove them 
- Managing the surgery
- Post operation care
- Consultation through my entire pregnancy (including suggesting i meet the dietitian and physiotherapist to ensure that i have a normal delivery)
- Delivery of my baby girl on September 10th
- and finally, post pregnancy care

Dr. Manjula is great! There is no other way to put it.  She listens to you, recommends things that SUIT YOU and always looks at natural remedies before suggesting medication.  Her first and second step of treatment is always household things and medication is suggested only after things do not work using natural remedies.

She has a million patients (I am guessing :)) and is in and out of deliveries a lot but will always reply to your WhatsApp msg within 30 minutes (that is the most she has taken).  

She was ALWAYS available for us when we had questions and listened patiently.  On some occasions when she couldn't come to the hospital/clinic, she would let duty staff know exactly what to do and talk to you to tell you what the nursing staff would do.

At a time where you hear that doctors prefer C-sections, Dr. Manjula still pushes for normal delivery and works with you over 9 months to ensure that you do everything that you possibly can to make your own delivery smooth. In my case as well, she waited the recommended time to try and push for a NVD but as it had been about 16 hours since my water broke, she didnt have a choice and had to do a C-section.

I admire her passion to her job and patients and her energy levels :).  She is always smiling and positive.

If you are looking for a OB/GYN and Cloudnine Hormavu is a decent distance for you, I recommend you go see her right away.

Thanks Dr.Manjula
Deepak, Ritika and Aria <3

PS: Thank you Practo for recommending Dr. Manjula when I was looking for OB/GYNs
reply_text: Thankyou Ritika and Deepak for those kind words it means a lot for me

review:
I thought, I will keep this short and sweet; but for the doctor she is; the words that I write below are always going to be less indeed..!! 

***** *** ** *** **** ***** *** **** **** *** ******* ****** ** *** **** ****** **** ** ***** **** *** ********** *** ********** 

I and my husband had our initial hesitations to meet a doctor or go to Cloudnine which is such a huge hospital, in itself. But with the first visit with Dr. Manjula; we realized we could bank on her. 

We had a rough initial 3 months of pregnancy, to say the least; especially with the bleeding and passing of clots. During all this; the only hope for us was Doctors‚Äô words ‚ÄúThis is all normal.. nothing to worry..‚Äù I have probably troubled her the most during the first 3-4 months with constant whatsapp messages/calls. I used to be so hassled; that I would whatsapp her at least 3 times a week in addition to the queries/doubts during my routine monthly visits. Even with her busy schedule, she has always replied to all of my messages/calls and that always put me at ease. 

She has always been a very jovial and a very optimistic person to us. We used to drive from far and never ever thought of changing our doctor; coz we got very used to her optimistic responses and clear cut consultations. 
She would always try and make sure that we didn‚Äôt drive a lot because of the distance and would also make sure that we don‚Äôt do any unnecessary tests. 

She has been so approachable throughout; that we even ended up calling her at midnight, during the day of our childbirth. She made sure; that we were taken good care of when we reached the hospital for the emergency. We ended up having a normal delivery and that is all thanks to Dr. Manjula, because I reached a stage of labour pain where I started requesting Dr., to do a C-Sec. Only due to Dr. Manjula‚Äôs faith and persistence did we have a normal delivery. 

*** ** *** **** ****** ****** ***** **** *** **** The first thing that she asked us in our first visit was to trust her; and that is all that one needs to do with a doctor like her.

I was feeling a bit emotional today; coz I might now see her only after 6 months. I hope to keep in touch with you Doctor. Thanks for being the guiding light and the constant support throughout our pregnancy. We would probably not have endured it; had it not been you.

Thank you so much Doctor..

Maya & Anish

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
When we learnt that I was pregnant I wanted to consult a doctor who was fuss-free, friendly and a good listener. Alas, we chanced upon Dr. Manjula Deepak and she was all that I was looking for in a doctor!

She's so chirpy and humble that she puts you at ease immediately. One of the best things about her is that she knows all her patients by their names (which is a very rare trait for a doctor of her calibre these days!). 

Since I'm not the type who would refer to google to get answers on my health/pregnancy, Dr. Manjula Deepak was so patient with us and answered all our questions which I would usually write down and take during our appointment! Moreover, she was available 6 days a week at the clinic and forever available over a text message whenever I would panic about anything or if I missed asking her any particular question during the appointment.  

She has a very modern approach to pregnancy which breaks most stereotypes and I was glad that she encouraged me to go on with my daily life without making me feel like I was 'sick' and needed to restrain myself from doing anything. I thoroughly enjoyed my pregnancy under her guidance. During the course of my pregnancy I rode a bike, I travelled overseas, did long road trips,  drove to work until the 9th month, went for swims, exercised and even baked a cake the night before I was admitted! :) 

She is a very earnest, humble, friendly *** ************* doctor. I had a complication at the time of my labour and had to undergo an emergency C-section. But even through that phase Dr. Manjula comforted me and prepared me for a safe and healthy delivery. 

We are always grateful for all the encouragement and support Dr. Manjula offered us during our pregnancy. Our baby girl arrived on December 20th, 2017 and it was by far the best Christmas we ever celebrated! 

Thank you so much Doctor, you are a rockstar! 

Love,
Steffi D'souza and Sanjeeth Samuel
reply_text: Thankyou Steffi for those kind words it means a lot to me

review: Dr. Manjula Deepak is like an angel for us. We had been married for nine years. However my wife was not able to conceive. So we ended up paying numerous visits to doctors,gynacs etc. She did 3 Ivfs and 4 iuis all of which failed. We had given up all hopes of becoming parents when GOD answered us. My wife conceived naturally and we were extremely happy. So we ended up visiting Dr. Manjula without checking her experience etc. It was an enriching experience for us. She looked very casual and happy go-like person, quite unlike other doctors that we came across. She explained to us everything and took us into confidence. My wife is very inquisitive and analytical in her approach. So she asked her a lot of questions which Dr. Manjula answered with ease. We were extremely pleased with her personality,confidence and ease with which we could speak and approach her. Next during the entire period of pregnancy my wife used to call her, WhatsApp her at any time during day and night and she would reply back. This was really amazing considering that she is a busy doctor. Our delivery due date was around mid-April and we were planning for the same. However on the evening of April 2, my wife started having labor pain and we admitted her. Late at night she started having a lot of pain. Dr. Manjula arrived at 5am in morning and delivered my baby girl - angel. During labor my baby,s heart beat was erratic so Dr. Manjula took no chances and immediately took my wife to the delivery room and in no time she delivered. We admire her pragmatic decision and steadfastness. She is a very good doctor and we are obliged that she has helped us all the way. We can never forget this. We would like to recommend her to any couple who would like to have a baby. Thank you Doctor Manjula.......Amit Goswami and Somosree Banerjee

review:
After learning about my pregnancy I found Dr Manjula and one other doctor by going through Practo reviews. I booked an appointment with both, but as luck would have it I went to see Dr Manjula first and after that very first visit I knew she would be the perfect doctor for me and I never went to see anyone else. 

I had a normal delivery without epidural on Jan 22, 2018 and the whole experience from that first month of pregnancy till my visit post delivery have been very good. Doctor Manjula makes everything easier. The best things about her are that she's reachable, I used to text her whenever in doubt or facing any difficulty and she never failed to address my concern. Another great thing about Dr is that she is not fussy at all and respects her patient's choices. I had a completely vegan pregnancy and although it's not a common thing in India, she was fine with it as long as my test results were good and I was eating healthy. 
Dr Manjula also put my mind to ease a lot of times. As it was my first pregnancy I got a lot of advice from people in my life and whenever in doubt I used to check with her regarding what should I do. I liked that she was clear about what all are myths and what is sound advice. She's a good blend of modern medicine and age old wisdom. Another great thing about her is that she kept my husband involved in the entire pregnancy and he was present for all my appointments and during the delivery. He too felt calmer in her presence. We both trust her immensely and are glad we found her. 

It's always a pleasure to meet the ever smiling Dr Manjula. Thank you for everything!

review:
Well, I conceived last year in the month of April and got it tested through Dr Manjula in hospital. Me and my husband were so happy to know about the news. As the days passed, I got certain complications like spotting (and lumps) in initial days of pregnancy which lasted for almost 10-15 days and Dr Manjula asked me to take a tablet to stop spotting and sustain the pregnancy. I was also asked for a bedrest for 1-2 weeks after which spotting subsided. My dr. was always positive on me and never lost any hope. She always asked me NOT to Google anything and to always stay calm and happy. She believed in miracles and nature and so did I. I just followed her instructions and had supreme faith in my God. But my spotting was on and off till 3 months and I was always tensed on that. That‚Äôs not the end! Other complications like cystic swelling in umbilical chord, cyst in placenta, low lying placenta and a single umbilical artery were also diagnosed in 1st trimester scans..Due to these, I was asked to go through NIPT scan instead of double marker Test to check for the chromosomes related disorder. By grace of god, the reports were normal and also by the 2nd trimester the cysts were not visible. Even the placenta position was high. Spotting was totally stopped and then my pregnancy went smoothly apart from some normal ups and downs like urine infection in 2nd trimester, abdominal pain due to gas some days and other normal symptoms. Every now and then I used to reach hospital to get the scan done and Dr Manjula was like ‚ÄòI am a gone case‚Äô by nowüòä My husband and I used to get tensed so much that we just used to rush hospital without giving a second thought. And Mam was always available on WhatsApp and in hospital no matter what. She always responded to me immediately even in her super busy routine. She is really supportive and friendly and boosts your positivity and motivation level. I always got positive vibes from her. Moreover, she is always with full energy and so active that seeing her will really make you feel happy! Till the end, she had full faith on me that I will be able to deliver normally and I did it in her presence! A great doctor and above all, a great human being and so much down to earth. Having so many degrees and so much experience of handling many cases of complicated deliveries, she has no proud and is very sophisticated and patient. Would highly recommend her. Wishing to have my next pregnancy (if at all we plan) with her as well! God willing!

Wishing her all the best for all her future endeavours. God bless you Mam! Thankyou so much for giving us our precious gift!
reply_text: Thank you very much for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr. Manjula Deepak, The Angel 

Ours is a story of ups, downs, losses, endless tears, sleepless nights,  dreams,  hopes and finally a happy beginning!

I got pregnant for the first time after 3 years of marriage in 2020, which unfortunately turned out to be an ectopic pregnancy and I had to undergo an emergency salpinogectomy at Cloudnine HRBR to remove my right fallopian tube . As much as we were Thankful to God for saving us at the right time and preventing a fatality,  things went down South for us since then..... We faced a plethora of issues -   Low AMH, uncertainity of the left fallopian tube favouring a pregnancy,  doctors giving up on us and pushing us into IVF, which we even attempted and failed at, doctor giving up on me saying that "You Would Never Be Able to Conceive Naturally" , "Another IVF is the only option".  
We didn't have the energy to attempt another IVF and moved on and decided to give the hospital visits a break. During one of the hospital lab visits at Cloudnine HRBR, a senior nurse heard my story and recommended DR.Manjula Deepak. She said that i could just meet her once and I wouldn't even have to pay for the consultation, which amused me. I went ahead and met Manjuala ma'am, who was a person beaming with positive energy, she pushed me to believe that i will get pregnant and have my baby in my arms within a year.  A couple of months later, we saw a ray of hope when I conceived naturally. It was unbelievable to see something tiny grow inside me in the 4th week scan, which Manjula ma'am revealed. Unfortunately,  that ended up in a blighted Ovum and I was heartbroken. I remember breaking down terribly in Manjula ma'am's cabin. She stood by us and still didn't give up on me and asked me to meet Dr.Manju Nair, her very good friend at Cloudnine Fertility to help me further.

I consulted Dr.Manju Nair, a very positive & energetic doctor, for a month and she helped me with the accurate timing and provided me the right kind of medicines. In a month,  I conceived naturally again.  My heart was racing when Dr.Manjula Deepak performed my first scan at 4th week.  This time it looked better than the previous time and we had our fingers crossed for the next scan.  We prayed all Gods to bless us this time at least. Majula ma'am was very confident,  but I wasn't able to pull myself up considering my previous bitter experience.  

Finally the day of my first important scan arrived. My heart was racing like a train and I was just hoping that the radiologist could find a tiny heart beat inside me. I had mixed feelings as I lay in the scan room... when I suddenly heard the radiologist say "Can you hear that? That's your baby's heart beat".  Happiness is not just the right word to describe what I felt at that moment. 

 Manjula ma'am's belief and God's blessings finally turned things positive for us.  We can't thank Manjula ma'am enough for the support she extended throughout the 9 months even with my GDM issue,  filing us with her contagious positive energy and pushing us through every step till the final decisive day.... We had walked in for my final consultation to discuss my birth plan when Manjula ma'am's instinct told her to perform a C- section on the very same day.  We weren't prepared mentally,  I didn't even have my hospital bag ready! and I was ready for my C-section in 5 hours. We blindly trusted Manjula Madam cos we knew that she couldn't go wrong.  We were glad that we didn't push ourselves for induced labour, considering my previous history.  On April 21st 2022, at 5.06PM , I heard my little one cry in that OT and felt her soft skin on my cheek.... tears came rolling down..it was a dream come true.. 
Manjula ma'am's instinct saved us even at that moment since my baby had a loop of cord around her neck and any delay could have put us through situations we couldn't have imagined. 

Dr. Manjula Deepak - An angel with Positive energy, zeal,  never give up attitude and belief in God. She is the reason why we never gave up.  She is the reason why I am a mother today.  As I celebrate my first mother's day,  I would like to thank Dr.Manjula Deepak from the bottom of my heart for not giving up on me and keeping up her promise of bringing my little one into the world within a year of facing a frantic downhill path. 

The world needs such doctors! We love you Manjula ma'am ‚ù§Ô∏è  
Thank you Dr. Manjula Deepak and the amazing staff of Cloudnine HRBR for making the entire experience a smooth and memorable one üòä
reply_text: Thank you very much for your kind words it means a lot to me

review: Please note that we are sharing our experience with an hope that it may help someone who would be searching for good gynecologist and with a wish that even everyone should get the same experience what we have got... Whatever I'm sharing here is purely based on our own experience, this is not to influence/impress anyone nor by someone's compulsion.I'm not sure from where to start but even till today we just can't believe ourselves that we have met a doctor who will make you feel as you are one of their dearest friend...Yes that's true... We just choosed Manjula Deepak by reading the reviews updated on Practo (We should thank the people who have updated their honest experience on Practo). We got wondered by the number of reviews updated and the ratings provided by everyone on Practo, me and my husband started thinking is this doctor really good as described by everyone here. We were regular to Malleshwaram Cloudnine branch and after we shifted to TC Palya Main road it became difficult (travelling from TC Palya to Malleshwaram everytime) to visit the gynecologist (don't want to mention the name) whom we were visiting regularly so we started searching for good gynecologist around our location, as usual we started searching through online, In between in the month of Jun-19 I had some concerns on my health and by considering the number of years of experience provided on practo doctor's profile we choosed one of the senior gynecologist with 30  years experience (again don't want to mention their name) and visited Cloudnine HRBR and it was just normal consultation and was really not happy with that consultation so again started searching for gynecologist and luckily I found Manjula Deepak's profile on Practo and found that she is available in Cloudnine HRBR branch so consulted her for first time for the same problem, as that was a very ignorable concern she also suggested the same advice as previous senior gynecologist suggested, but in my first consultation only I'm pretty much impressed by her nature, the confidence and the feeling I got on her after coming out from the consultation room was completely different. Almost for a week I discussed about Manjula Deepak with my husband by describing him about her nature, the way she spoke to me with regard to my health concern, her dressing sense, after listening to all this even my husband told me that the way you are describing her gives me a feeling that she is a doctor with different qualities so let's continue with her. Yes I should completely agree on it and sure she has blessed with unique personalities to be a doctor.The reason I was checking for gynecologist in May-19 month was to plan for our second baby and before that I wanted to get clarified on few concerns I was having on my health. Later in Oct-19 I became pregnant and off course how can I think of anyone else when Manjula ma'am is around us. Our journey went so smoothly not even a single day I had different thought in my mind, we were so relaxed and our confidence level was keep boosting post every consultation by the way she was explaining, by the way she was making us understand each and everything in detail was really phenomenal. We blessed with baby girl on 10th Jun 2020 and seriously I just can't describe how everything went smoothly and without facing any hurdle our little one entered the world.A big thanks to Doctor Manjula Deepak for making us to feel proud parents of our little one... Thank you MD ma'am... We wish all the very best to you... Triveni Hareesh

context: Caesarean Section (C Section),High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
First of all Thank you so much doctor for guiding us  each day  and  Now we are happy to announce everyone  that we are blessed with Baby girl and this is my second little angel

Let me call out why we considered this second delivery is High risk care Pregnancy . couple of reasons to cite out( My view) 
1. My First kid is Special Kid ( Autistic)
2. we planned and my wife conceived after 10 years . I meant The age gap between my two kids are 10 years
3. My wife age is >38
4. Gestational Diabetes was discovered during  2nd month of this pregnancy
5. Wife having Thyroid 

Thanks to Practo again , I have consulted Dr Manjula deepak after reading postive reviews on Practo

Dr Manjula is a very Honest , sincere lovable doctor. She takes care of all mothers and babies with atmost care. I  know being doctor , all doctors are very patient  in dealing their patients, however this Lady is much above than others . I am always surprised with her memory power , her activeness  and response 24*7. Her response in whats up is immediate , absolutely no exaggeration . The secret of success for Dr Manjula is PASSION. she is so passionate in her profession she even keeps her family second
Let me cite few examples which i felt as WOW factor 

1. Usually when any symptom is identified  during pregnancy time, we tend to search google and gather , analyze some information before go to doctor. and we know what most of the doctors answer when we share our knowledge from google. 
I   had been in these situations and you know what Dr Manjula response in such cases... She  asks us what did Google say.. What it they suggest .. This is wonderful quality , she listens to any one and try to  understand patient anxiety and in fact agrees and suggests if that is correct

2. Enormous Memory Power - DDR4 Infinite GB. She calls all her patients with Names  and   we started Visiting her since second month till C-section ( done by Dr manjula) . Any time  we meet  she always call by Name and more importantly she remembers complete history of the patient with out reading file . At least she sees 35 patients per day. This is truly appreciated , only comes with Passion on the job

3.  She  likes to listen, take input from other doctors.. purely no EGOS. One such incident is we undergone many tests for this kid ( second one) as my first kid is special kid. when she was reviewing  one of the report results , she is very open to check with other doctors and accordingly suggested next steps

4. She always  appreciates other doctors  and other staff. Morever she always tell better consult other doctor as i am not expert in this domain . this  she cited when we consulted for thyroid and sugar 

5. More importantly, she gives importance to religious customs and understand parents traditions and she  is open to listen on these grounds as well
6. Even my mother was so impressed with the  her energy levels and she  is happy with doctor

My baby is currently 10 days old and we are enjoying parenthood

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Manjula Deepak aka "MD" at hospital boards is not only a doctor! She is a friend and her friendly nature makes every pregnant ladies and their family members so comfortable with her detailed explanation on issues and happening. I had GDM which is not of so high range and not so low as well, Manjula Deepak was so generous to explain its effects/limitations and the cautions to cultivate. Doctor had committed us that "I will try for Normal" but not at the cost of baby or mother's health (This statement actually made us wrong perception on the scenario that GDM patients will have C-section 100% even though she did mentioned that she has done N number of NNVD's for GDM cases). The due date was on 2nd Jan 2019, Myself and my Husbands expectations was to have baby on new year with NVD + Girl baby(I know Dr. MD cannot do anything abut it). Dr. Manjula mentioned about the protocol of GDM that the delivery should happen with in 38 weeks + 6 days. We expressed our expectations on having baby on Jan, Dr. Manjula made us aware with all technical reasons for not to push it to Jan and I had to admit on 26th Night. Best part is, Dr. Manjula visited at 10:30 PM/12:00 AM/6:30 AM/10:30 AM/1:30 PM/4:00PM/ 6:30 PM and 8:30 PM. I mentioned these timings to re-iterate that the main doctor visits her patient so frequently even though having 2 duty doctors is just act of respect and HOSPITALITY. Even though my husband has done whole story on how u delivered since he was witnessing everything, Dr. Manjula didn't even left 0.1% to make NVD to me which is unbelievable for the situation I was in(GDM). She never left hope on making NVD. Key decisions made by Dr. MD :- 
1) 2 times inducing pain via Jel
2) Dr Manjula Deepak came and examined the cirvix and good news was it was for 1 CM open and 50% clavax. after 10 hours. Any doctor would have done C section
3) Manjula Deepak came, cirvix was at 2CM only.and was not improvee, she decided to break the water to see if baby has done pee, but there was no as such, since heartbeat of the baby was good, suffex was 50%, chaitra endurance was good but  only dilatation was 2CM. Manjula Deepak had to take a call to go for epidomal since it serves both for dilatation open for normal delivery and general anesthesia for c section. Had to go with that.
4) Manjula Deepak came band checked the dilation, it has varied from 2 to 3 (Asked to wit for NVD) 
5) Manjula Deepak found the contraction is better and the Cirvix is at 5CM. (asked to wait)
6) LAST BUT NOT LEAST, A motivation voice from DR. MD at last moment "" PUSH HARD CHAITRA, ONE HARD PUSH WILL MAKE IT" made it possible for NVD. 

Yes folks, Good doctors do exists and it proved for me by Dr. Manjula Deepak. (Do not think that this is paid feedback).
reply_text: Thankyou for those kind words it means a lot for me

review:
With Dr Manjula Deepak we had the very best and memorable experience. We would like to quote few words which best explains Dr Manjula Deepak;

1.	Dr Manjula is so friendly, always cheerful and have high level of energy which helped us to build the rapport on the very first meeting.
2.	Highly professional *** **** **** ********* ** ********** ***** ****** *********** ** ****** ****** **********
3.	Down to Earth, open hearted, addressed all our doubts in simple terms which helped us to build the trust. 
4.	A very good listener and gives enough time during every consulting and ensures adequate solutions by thoroughly understanding the overall health issue and mental states.
5.	A complete doctor who is highly dedicated and has the ability and capacity to give extra care to every single patients 
6.	Knowingly or unknowingly prepare the patient with high level of motivation, confidence and excitement to have a normal delivery.
7.	Astute timing and decision making quality naturally comes out of sheer experience.
8.	Taught us to experience and enjoy every single moment of the pregnancy, never loaded any fear factor during any stage.
9.	Always suggest ‚Äúwhat is required‚Äù from a medical/mental stand point, advised the significance of exercise and the importance of taking adequate rest.
10.	Last but not the least ‚ÄúAvailable any time‚Äù connected through phone or what‚Äôs up messages at any odd time/festivals/personal celebration; showcases the dedication, empathy and love towards the profession and patient. 

Our experience;

After the very first meeting with Dr Manjula we are so sure that we met the right Doctor and we are on safe hands. 

Through Dr Manjula guidance we both were so equipped with good understanding about the do‚Äôs and don‚Äôts to follow to be on a safer side. During the fifth month my wife was little feverish and Dr Manjula helped us to overcome the fewer with less impact of antibiotic medicines. Dr Manjula never unnecessarily pushed us to do scans or other medical measures.

Everything was super fine but on the 7th month my mother was unwell and was hospitalised and we all went back to hometown. The situation eventually became critical and we lost my mother after 21 days of suffering. My mother and my wife were so closed to each other and it was very difficult to go through the phase. My wife was mentally down and honestly we had no idea about what‚Äôs next and entirely lost the reality about the baby. During this period Dr Manjula was in touch with us over the phone and also guided us to go for the 7th month scan and verified the report we send over what‚Äôs up and guided us with the next steps. 

This point in time we both were in such a confused state of mind weather to have the delivery in home town or to go back to Bangalore. After meeting a new Doctor at home town we realized where Dr Manjula stands and the value and care she gives to her patients. We decided to come back to Bangalore just because of the amount of trust and confidence we build with Dr Manjula was enormous and we need to have a safe delivery.

Still remember how much care Dr Manjula shared with us after this incidence and honestly we felt huge relief because of her kind words and dedication. We followed all the advices and training tips shared by Dr Manjula. Through Dr Manjula‚Äôs proper guidance we had a normal delivery and blessed with a healthy, beautiful baby girl. We both cannot express in words how much Dr Manjula helped us to sail through the entire phase. Our babies‚Äô delivery date and Dr Manjual‚Äôs wedding anniversary was on the same day and I just wanted to point that Dr Manjula was available all time during the important day in her life and in fact she spend time to share some sweet memories. 

I strongly recommend Dr Manjula *** *** ****** **** *** *** ****************** ***** * ******

tags: None
review:
We are blessed with a healthy baby boy.

Two and half years back, it was our misfortune that we had to lose our first baby when he was a month old. This happened  at a hospital in Kolar. Since then we went through lot of struggles and fear. We were eagerly waiting to get our baby back. 
Once my second pregnancy was confirmed, by God's grace we landed in protective hands of Dr. Manjula Deepak. With what had happened previously, we wanted a helping hand both mentally and medically to overcome the fears and have a smooth and healthy pregnancy. 
Words are not enough to describe how Dr. Manju took care of me. In our very first meeting, we she made us feel comfortable and gave us confidence. She was friendly and caring in each and every part of pregnancy. Her touch, her talks, gave me much courage to have a happy pregnancy. Her dedication towards her profession is just mind blowing. More than a doctor she was a very good friend and a guiding hand. It's just not words; every time she examined things to me she would pass on so much courage that kept me going. She ensured that every question was answered and all aspects of pregnancy was covered. She responded immediately to every message and phone call. During my labor she arrived at the hospital immediately during late night hours and stayed there till the baby was delivered, post midnight. It's was her wedding anniversary but she sacrificed her time with family to take care of me. She handled me so beautifully, more than a doctor she was like a family member, like a sister. She supported me in pain. She is such a beautiful doctor I can keep telling about her. During my labor, she was telling her colleague "I promised her that I will give her a healthy baby". That's the responsibility and dedication that she has towards her patients. It was a normal delivery. 
It's amazing how she makes her every patient feel special. Even after my delivery, She ensured that the recovery was good. She is a beautiful lady in her heart and profession. I just love her.  May God bless her with all goodness and happiest life ever in all possible ways. She is a goddess of love, care, goodness, who brings life to this world.

We more than strongly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak. 

We are forever indebted to you, my dear Doctor. Thank you for getting my life back to me. 

- Our little prince and his happy parents Chandana, Shiva Raman and our entire family.

 Love you Doctor
reply_text: Thanks a lot Chandana it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I switched to Dr. Manjula in 1st trimester of my pregnancy, dissatisfied from my previous doctor, and without a doubt it turned out to be a best decision.She is always high on energy and very open minded about things that some conservative doctors are apprehensive to support:1) I was allowed to drive 4 wheeler as long as I feel comfortable, which I did up until my 8th month of pregnancy. 2) Being a pet parent (of 2 cats) I was never discouraged from being close to them, sleep with them and pamper them as usual with kisses and hugs throughout my pregnancy. 3) Being someone who enjoys wearing high heels, she never discouraged me from wearing them as long as I feel comfortable and no back pain. (I wore them up until 6th month when I started to feel back pain due to added pregnancy weight)4) She always encouraged me to take long walks and stairs if feeling comfortable.5) With one of my major worry being becoming fat postpartum, she ensured to keep a very close watch on my weight gain in 9 months and pushed me to exercise so I can deliver normally. Her efforts bore fruit when I was able to deliver a healthy baby of 3.5 kgs normally and within 2-3 weeks postpartum I reached back my pre-pregnancy weight. :) (with only little toning and firming away from my prepregnancy body)She is very quick to respond on all the queries over msgs which I feel helped me a lot in my journey with this being my first baby.During labour I wasn't very cooperative due to my low pain threshold but she was super patient with me all along and pushed me for normal delivery.She is one awesome person who will always make you feel good about yourself. Hence without a doubt she will always remain my 'go to doctor' in future as well.
reply_text: Thank you very much srishti for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: None
review:
Hi All,

I consulted Manjula after seeing reviews in practo for pre pregnancy counselling.
July 2017 - Consulted for pre pregnancy counselling. After blood test diagnosed with little hypothyroidism. Doctor advised me to take medicine for the same. I convinced her saying will wait for another one month and then we can start with medication as it was in border line madam with all positive thoughts asked me to take only supplements. 
Aug - 2017 - continued to take supplements and we had intercourse as per the schedule given.
Sep - 2017 - As my periods didn't show we visited cloudnine and found that I was pregnant. :)
. 
. visited doctor as per the dates given. 
During 7th month of pregnancy we decided to go to other hospital as new cloudnine hospital was not tied up with insurance company to opt for cashless for bed booking. 
But when we informed madam about this she convinced us not worry and didn't let us go as she is the one who had treated me from pre pregnancy counselling to till then... 
. 
with all positive thoughts given by madam I used go to office till 2 weeks before delivery. 
. 
04 May 2018-  11 pm found that water broke and I called Dr. Manjula and she asked me to visit hospital. Before I reach hospital she had called up duty doctor and informed them to start with the procedure.
05 May 2018 - Morning she came and asked me to be cool as I was worried that Since water had broken I had deliver through C section. But at 2.30pm I delivered baby gal with Normal vaginal delivery which was like a dream come true for me.
As my weight was always on the lower side no body even thought that I can have NVD. But madam never demotivated me in this matter instead she always sent me home with positive thoughts.
I had just believed Dr Manjula Deepak and ended up with fruitful outcome.
Thanks a lot madam.
Would definitely consult you for my second pregnancy. :)

Regards
Pallavi and Manohar
reply_text: Thankyou Pallavi and Manohar for those kind words it means a lot to me

tags: None
review:
We are happy to share that we have been blessed with a boy and girl after a long and tough journey. We had been very low emotionally as our pregnancy where not successful. We have been consulting a renowned and much experienced consultant of cloudnine. In the first trimester due to nausea and severe vomitting got a chance to visit her as she was practicing in Cloud9 near to our place. We have to say that our first meeting was that she brings in lot of energy and sowed lot of optimism. She has spent more than 20 mins for this and shared her contact number in case of emergency or for any clarification. We have been pleased with the way we have been councelled and this remind us a snippet 

Before you examine the body of a patient,
Be patient to learn her story.
For once you learn her story,
You will also come to know her body.

We feel the rough road turned into a pleasant journey with her humane touch. Every time we visit her she does a scan for few mins  on our request and convince us that everything was normal. During our 30 week consultation I was given steroid injection for lung maturity which was scheduled next week so we can avoid travelling. After 2 days at home I got labour pain and called doctor she immediately responded and asked us to visit clinic. She examined and suggested to be ready so booked an ambulance and accompanied( which I don't think any dr will  do leaving 2 kids at home) along with and got delivered a boy and girl post mid night. She had waited till 3.00am till I was awake and convinced that both are doing good. Post which we spent a month in NICU during which she visit us frequently and discus with pedetrician on the progress and update us. We feel she is very good at " taking right decision at right time. 
We had a luxury of calling her anytime and discuss on our silly issues for which she replies patiently.

Sometime a small decision will change the life forever. Now we are more happy with our kids and got a good family friend too.

Thanks will be small word and we shall carry the memory for lifelong.


Charumathy & Rajeswaran
reply_text: Thanks a lot Charu and Rajesh it means a lot to me

review:
Here I am finally writing about my experience with Dr Manjula, as I and my husband embraced parenthood all we wanted was to find the right doctor, after a long search and visits to various hospitals and meeting with numerous doctors we landed at cloudnine HRBR to meet Dr Manjula.

After all the reviews I read and heard I finally bagged my opportunity to meet Manjula, my first meeting with her was very positive, her vibrant personality and her nature got us to stick on and choose her to be our doctor for the next 9 months until we welcomed our daughter on June 18th 2023 through a normal delivery.

She was ever ready to help, assist and soothe us throughout our journey and made it fun-filled, safe and joyous.

In the era of csection she made sure I had a normal delivery, thanks to her confidence in me and to have made us feel confident enough to get through the whole process of delivering my little one.

Through her energy, wisdom and care Dr Manjula in our lives made waves of memories, thank you doc.! You'll never be forgotten.

Loads of love 
Sherel & George

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Initially I was consulting a different doctor from another hospital. After miscarriage the way that doctor reacted was very unpleasant. So we visited Dr.Manjula Deepak at Cloud9 HRBR for second opinion. Manjula ma'am explained everything in detail even before we asked her and clarified all queries that I had in mind. It was her way of handling the situation and explaining the facts made us feel better. We immediately decided to continue with Manjula ma'am. She gave us confidence to try again. 
She is friendly with everyone and has a positive vibe, which helps us to remain calm and gain more confidence.
I had lot of other health issues throughout the pregnancy and Manjula ma'am was very caring and always reachable on whatsapp.
Even when labour started 3 weeks earlier than due date, i did not panic because of the way Manjula ma'am spoke to me. Baby heart rate started slowing down during labour but still Manjula ma'am tried her best to continue with normal delivery. Finally baby was born in normal delivery and both mother and baby are safe. All credits to Manjula ma'am. 
We sincerely thank Dr.Manjula Deepak from bottom of our hearts for all the care from day one. She is the best.

review: We visited Dr. Manjula Deepak for the first time a few months back and little did we know that she would be the Angel in our life. 10 months fast forward, and here we are with a little boy in our hands all thanks to Dr. Manjula. She is very friendly, knows how to talk to patients and explain the health conditions. The first time we went, we had to hear a news that would have driven us very sad but the way she explained and assured that everything would be alright at the end, gave us hopes. We just followed what Mam asked us to and indeed all went well. The positive vibes she spreads inspired us and you will feel inspired even by talking to her. She is such a joy hopping around in hospital premises. Even during regular scans during pregnancy, though there were minor issues called out in scan reports, she assured us nothing to worry. During labour too, we felt very confident when we knew Mam was around. She assured we would try to go with normal delivery 95% and finally we delivered normal delivery - the great part of it, we would attribute to Mam. Can't forget the moment she raised the baby and told, it's boy. She is really an angel on earth to us. Glad we chose to consult with her.

review: Doctor Manjula Deepak was literally a god send for us. We shifted to cloudnine hrbr after consulting with a major hospital for almost 9 months. Doctor took us on in first week of December with the due date being 22nd Dec. In the first meeting itself she spoke to us and counselled us more than 30 mins. She explained everything patiently, advised exercises, and dietary changes to help the onset of labour smoothly. Finally we elected to go in for a c section as my wife was not dilating and also had adenomyosis/ fibroid. I was allowed in the operation theatre during the procedure and could be there with my wife to speak to her and support her. it was a magic moment as I saw my daughter pulled out swiftly by the magical hands of this doctor. Doctor took extra care to look into minor aspects related to the surgery, to make sure my wife was comfortable throughout. It was a landmark day for us. Doctor is available throughout on call, whatsapp, sms etc. she will always get back to you for any concern even after delivery. overall an excellent experience with Dr Manjula.

review: Dr Manjula Deepak is a great doctor as well as very good human being. I had consulted her from my second month of pregnancy . It was my first child so I was little nervous and worried. She always gave supportive gesture and right suggestion. I don't had any complication so recommended minimal test and scan even I wanted more scan as it was my first pregnancy and little scared about my baby. She always says, Don't worry everything is fine and if required, I will suggest scan or Test. You will always get positive vibe from her. I enjoyed my pregnancy journey because of her only. She listens your problem very calmly and explain solution in details. Sometime she tells in advance, you might be experiencing these problem what I wanted to discuss with her. She emphasized for normal delivery from my first visit even I was not sure about , will deliver normally. I had normal delivery because of her supported and encouragement. Throughout my pregnancy I found her as a friend more then a doctor, she always reachable on WhatsApp or call whenever I needed her. Thank you doctor for your support.

review:
We visited Dr.Manjula Deepak as soon as we decided to have a baby. Right from our first appointment, her friendly response, advices, treatment made us feel so homely and comfortable that I couldn't thank god enough for helping us find her.  
Throughout my pregnancy, Dr.Manjula consistently guided me towards a healthy and traditional delivery where I followed all her suggestions by keeping myself physically active which only helped me towards a healthy baby. It was until my 9th month scan where I was worried after knowing that my baby is in breech position and it could be a C section if the baby doesn't turn down. I was disheartened knowing that. Dr.Manjula boosted my confidence to such a level where I happily accepted her decision, I trusted my doctor from the beginning and it was obvious that I put my trust on her and faith in god. The Ceserean surgery was done so smooth that I was able to walk and do my chores in just a week. Overall, my experience with Dr.Manjula deepak was fabulous. The moment we would see her with a smile, all our worries would vanish. :) 
Thank you so much Dr.Manjula mam!!

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Dr Manjula is an angel with a stethoscope for me! 
She shows empathy, which for me many doctors failed at. She put me at ease, answered my questions (believe me, I had many and at every appointment) and in tough times, she gave me a hope and a prayer. She let me know the procedures before hand and explained it in detail, be it as minute as a need for an injection. Personally, she prefers her patients to undergo a vaginal delivery if possible but when it was decided as a c-section for me, she supported me and made sure I did not fall into a guilt trip! ( Well, cos I was mentally preparing for a vaginal delivery for 9 months!). I'll never forget her saying that she doesn't want me to have a traumatic birthing experience (no one ever told me that birthing could be an experience otherwise). And so it was, not a pain free but a trauma free experience! Amidst her daily count of dozens of patients, she remembered a tiniest detail about my condition and ensured to tell the on duty doctor prior to my surgery and made sure that I do not undergo any stress cos of that. You would see her enter the hospital with an aura that will just awe you. I have seen her at the hospital at odd hours attending to patients, spending overnight after a procedure and finally meeting lots of other patients the next day with the same zest. Sometimes I wonder if she gets a break or vacation ever. 
So yeah I did finally find a trustworthy, my go-to obgyn afterall!
reply_text: Thank you very much saumya for your kind words it means a lot to me

context: Pregnancy Check Up,High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Caesarean Section (C Section),
review:
Consulted Doctor Manjula Deepak for pregnancy. 
This was my first pregnancy and I had conceived MCDA twins .
I wanted to consult someone with good experience given my case .She came highly recommended by colleagues and friends . 
From my experience she is definitely someone who knows what she is doing . She explained things well , she was very open to questions / doubts  and She was extremely friendly and this made me very comfortable. One thing that I have personally observed on many occasions is that she will not prescribe unnecessary medications , I have personally seen her avoid or prescribe a lower dose . 
She also has an excellent memory, she would almost remember everything I discussed to her in my previous visit and would follow up on that in the next visit . It was reassuring to me that she understood things around me and wasn‚Äôt just looking at reports . 

I safely delivered my boys via c section . She was so swift at the procedure and kept me comfortable in the OT .  All my family members too were very impressed with her work. 

I would highly recommend Dr Manjula Deepak.I am very happy that I consulted her.

review:
*** ******* ****** ** *** **** ************ ** *** ***** Everyone I spoke to in the kammanahalli - HRBR Layout knew her n suggested her as the best option. 
My initial treatment was in chennai from a renowned hospital and doctor, so l was very hesitant to continue my treatment in blore. But to just try my options I was suggested Dr. Manjula Deepak, and meeting her was enough to change my mind. 
Even though we were meeting her for the first time, she made us feel so comfortable. The casual and super friendly manner of hers can put us at ease immediately. She never forgets who we are even if v meet her after 2 months! 
When it comes to treatment she is very clear and transparent. She tries her best for normal ( I had normal though my chances of cesarean was little high). Every medication or scan prescribed by her is only on a need on basis and not unnecessary.Her positivity radiates so much that even while in labour just her presence gives us so much confidence and keeps us calm.  Her dedication and the connection she builds with the patient and their family is what makes her the best!! She not only supports the mother in labour but also the father who is usually overlooked. 
She is a wonderful being with so much energy and enthusiasm. My gratitude for her cannot be put in words.

review: I don't think a doctor can have a better bonding with their patients what you have with yours. Please don't change this.In a way your approach towards your patients make them feel better sometimes without even using medicine. Two doctors can read a same book and do the same practical but decision making is something which makes one better from another. My wife just completed 28 weeks of her gestational period and was suffering from severe pre eclampsia. She reached to 8.2 for euric acid and 3  for urine albumin. With those numbers she could have had multiple organ failure at any time. But you made a decision to get the delivery done and saved both the mother and the baby. The baby was only 840 gm. I felt it was a co incidence when I changed from a top notch gynecologist  on 4th month of her pregnancy for some reason(no offense, some doctors are not for everyone) to another top one (Manjula) üòÄ. Now I know why that reason happened, god wanted us to meet you and put our lives at a safer hand. Words/gifts/fees nothing is enough for us to repay what you have given us. We will owe you for life and will keep on praying for your good health and long life. On our way back to home we were feeling sad that we won't get to meet you often now. God bless you üôè. review:
I  have started consulting Dr. Manjula in the 3rd trimester.  Dr. Manjula has treated me very well.

On the first day of consultation, Dr. Manjula has enquired about all the previous checkups, scans, medication, exercise, and diet I have followed. Since the first delivery was normal, after examining me and the fetal position, she gave us the confidence that the second delivery will also be a normal one. She has advised me to do specific exercises and to follow the prescribed diet.

I and my husband are very much happy about the way Dr.Manjula has interacted with us. She is very friendly, confident, and explains the procedures very well. She made us feel confident and prepared us to take our minds off all the worries.

We rushed to the hospital due to labor pain and water breakdown at 12:30 am midnight and only the duty doctor was there at that time. But, by 3 am when I was in the labor room Dr. Manjula had reached there to take care of my delivery. I was very happy and relieved with the presence of Dr. Manjula there at the time of delivery. Dr. Manjula supported me throughout the process of NVD.

Dr. Manjula is an amazing and extraordinary doctor. Above all she is a dynamic, friendly, and energetic human being.  Me and my family would like to thank her from the bottom of our hearts for all her support. 

I highly recommend Dr. Manjula for everything related to Obstetrics & Gynaecology.

review:
We came across Dr.Manjula from Practo and took our first appointment with her, meeting her for the first time itself - was an awesome experience for us. She always had a good instinct. She was able to tell just by touching that I was carrying twins. Initially i was not ready, but Dr.Manjula adviced and motivated me and it made me more confident in carrying my babies. She motivated me during each visit which made me mentally strong and helped me to carry my babies till 37 weeks.
By God's grace and Dr.Manjula's help, I delivered a boy and a girl baby. The diet suggested by her helped me in delivering my babies with good weight. Dr.Manjula prepared me mentally and physically for c-section, As both of my babies were in breech position.

The best part in her is the way she understands her patients. Even though, I was carrying twins she did not ask me to take advanced treatment or medicines or unecessary tests. The positive response from her, makes me even more stronger. I am so much thankful for the care and time she rendered to me and quick response  from her whenever I disturb her by call or messages. She is so energetic and enthusiastic easily approachable person who spread positivity among us. I feel so lucky that I got a wonderful doctor who always makes me comfortable. Myself and my whole family wholeheartedly thank Dr.Manjula for her support  and will  be in touch with this wonderful person. Continue this good work!

God's Grace + Dr. Manjula Deepak + 9 months of pleasurous pregnancy, that's all it took for us to meet our little princess. I met Dr. Manjula during my first pregnancy at the age of 31 and soon realised that I am in safe hands. Initially, before going to consult her, we used to prepare our queries to ask. But when we actually met her she used to explain everything that was in our minds without being asked! This made us feel so relaxed and cared that we would forget all worries. I fell sick few times during pregnancy and called her at odd times, but she always listened to our problems patiently before giving an exact solution. Because of the confidence she had given us we could enjoy a worry free pregnancy and prepare mentally and physically for the D-Day. Manjula ma'am was so precise about the delivery date that my water broke on the 2nd day of 40th week, just as she predicted. I called her at 4.30am in the morning, no surprises! she picked the call and guided us to get admitted in the hospital. When the labor really started and I could hold her hand, it felt like I was with my mother, fully assured and cared. My princess was blessed to have taken birth in her expert hands, it was a NORMAL DELIVERY!! We couldn't have asked for more.

You are the most active, stylish & sweet person we have ever met and we would like to take this opportunity to thank you ma'am for everything from the bottom of our hearts, may God bless you & your family.

tags: None
review: Words are not enough to express our gratitude to this amazing lady...! As usual couples, we scouted  for the best doctor for my first pregnancy and we came across Manjula Deepak from Cloudnine. We struck the chord almost immediately on our first meeting, I found a friend in her,a friend who was available at any hour to comfort me. My first pregnancy went in normal, except for the fact that my child has passed motion in the uterus just as I got my labour pain. Dr Manjula suggested that we go in for a cesarean as the child would injest the motion and would lead to complications later. We went with her advice and gave birth to a healthy Princess. Same went as on for our second child. My first child was barely 6 months and I had become pregnant again,we were confused and wanted to terminate and had visited Manjula for advice as the first was a cesarean, she comforted us and told I could continue my pregnancy if I wanted to and that I would have no issue giving birth to the second. heartfelt thanks to her, I gave birth to a baby boy. We are a complete family now, all just because we had Dr Manjula Deepak by our side. This is for all new, going to be parents. You don't need a doctor, you need to find a friend in a doctor  and she's the one. THANK YOU SO MUCH, MANJULA...! WE LOVE YOU LOADS & FRIEND'S FOR A LIFETIME...!

review:
Ive been through my pregnancy and childbirth journey with Dr Manjula Deepak in entirety. I picked her from the myriad of Ob-gyns available in Bangalore solely on the basis of practo reviews and it has done justice. 
Dr Manjula really does keep the best interest of the patient in mind while recommending a solution or a course of treatment. 
Her demeanour is always positive and she does to a large extent respects the wishes of her patients. 
One of the most outstanding points that I appreciate her for is the fact that she believes in the concept of a healthy pregnancy by insisting on the practise of self control when it comes to food so weight gain stays in the healthy range and at the same time suggesting  appropriate exercises to aid that goal. This helped me have the pregnancy and delivery I had aimed for. 
The only downside to my experience was that the waiting time to see the doctor was too much every time, this was especially hard during covid peak months where one would not want to remove masks to eat and drink freely.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review:
Our experience with Dr. Manjula Deepak was amazing. My wife was advised by our previous doctor to terminate pregnancy due to multiple fibroids and thereafter to go for laparoscopic myomectomy to remove fibroids.  After termination of pregnancy, my wife continued bleeding for three months. We were scared and confused as the bleeding was not stopping. Then my colleague recommended me to visit Dr. Manjula Deepak.  Me and my wife was very much impressed with her confidence and explanations at the very first meeting. She gave medicine for the bleeding to stop and waited for the normal menstrual cycle to return before planning for surgery. She advised for open myomectomy as the fibroids were big in size and suggested us to plan for pregnancy after two months of surgery. The journey of pregnancy won‚Äôt be that seamless without her guidance and support. Finally, my wife had caesarian delivery and we were blessed with a baby boy. Dr Manjula Deepak is an amazing person, and I haven‚Äôt met such a down to earth doctor in my life. I can blindly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak to any couple who are planning to have child. Thanks, doctor for all the support. 
From Sandipta and Durba

review:
We consulted Dr Manjula Deepak at 20 weeks of pregnancy after hearing positive stories from couple of friends. And it was the best decision we made. We were totally taken by her positive attitude, friendliness and jovial nature. As my pregnancy was through IVF and I was sceptical about changing the doctor at 20 weeks, Dr made me feel very confident and advised to proceed as a natural pregnancy as I did not have any complications. I was active all through my pregnancy and doctor was always available on phone for any concerns and queries.

Coming to my delivery, my water broke at 36 weeks and rushed to the hospital. Doctor induced me with pain and continuously monitored for progress. As I had some bleeding, doctor decided to go for C-section. But after getting into the OT, I was 8cm dilated and doctor quickly suggested we go for normal delivery within 30 minutes also the baby heartbeat was good. We trusted her decision and proceeded, Within few pushes I delivered a baby boy. We immensely appreciate the doctor‚Äôs timely decision and confidence in opting for normal delivery at that moment. 

We are forever grateful to you and our first pregnancy experience was all the more special because of you. Thanks a lot doctor.

Highly recommend Dr Manjula Deepak for pregnancy care and management. *** ** *** **** ** *** ***** ** *********** *** you can put all your trust in her.

review: Consulted Manjula mam for my second pregnancy.  In 5th month scan we got to know that I will get BP as my parents have BP and in my first pregnancy too I got BP in 8th month. Mam started medication and I was normal until my 8th month. From 8th my BP was raising and not under control. Manjula mam daily asked to message her my BP readings and closely monitored my condition. She tried to deliver on my 37th week but on my 35th week I was feeling blur vision. I have informed my condition and she asked to visit hospital immediately. She monitored my BP and taken timely decision to deliver. I am blessed with baby girl and baby is also all good not shifted to NICU. Post delivery also daily she visited twice and saw my condition and regularly talking to duty doctors on treatment to be given. I haven't seen such a kind and down to earth doctor in this corporate world. Our entire family is thankful to Manjula mam for the care she has taken throughout my pregnancy. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I visited Dr Manjula for my second pregnancy.  She is very friendly and approachable doctor which is a very important factor during pregnancy and child birth. She is full of energy and is very passionate about her profession which is quite evident when you see her. On the first consultation itself she shared her phone number where we could get our queries answered. ( which is rare these days).
For every query, she promptly responded and I did not have to run to the hospital for a consultation. She also made sure that I avoid multiple trips to the hospital in  covid times.

In my 9th month, when the baby had not descended, she asked me to get a scan to check if everything was alright. As she rightly suspected , baby had not one but three chords around the neck. The radiologist mentioned to me that usually doctors prefer a c-section in such cases which worried me as I was very keen on a normal delivery. But Dr Manjula calmed us down and explained the situation to us in detail. She also assured us that she will try her best to make sure its a normal delivery and only if there is an emergency she will go for a c-section.

On the day of induction, she made sure the staff was briefed and made sure the whole process was monitored meticulously. Finally with her efforts and the supportive staff, my baby was delivered normally.

Thank you doctor for making my pregnancy a pleasant and a happy one!

review:
Here is my second pregnancy story, 
Before Delivery:
I am 34 and it was my second pregnancy after 6 years of my first delivery. From the beginning  i wanted  it to be a normal delivery, since the first one was C section and i did not want to go through it again, Doctor Manjula was very supportive and encouraged me to do normal from day one i started seeing her.
On Delivery Day:
The pain started on April 12th early Morning and it was periodic pain, Morning  7.30AM I did whats-app text to  Dr.Manjula and she asked me to go to Cloud nine by 8:30. She checked me by 9:00 AM and said pain is started it may take 5 to 6 hrs and we will go for normal all looks good. I was took to the Labor room immediately with Husband. Next few hours was horrible since the pain was keep going up and down, by 11:30 they induced pain  and i was not able to bear the pain and i went for the epidural injection to reduce pain, by 2:03PM I delivered a baby boy and they allowed Husband to be with me in the delivery.  It was good instructions and care from Dr. Manjula and nurses from Cloud nine made me it possible. Post delivery I was in the hospital for 3 days and they took care of Baby and me very well.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I met Dr. Manjula Deepak for the first time in 2nd half of 2017 when I was struggling to conceive. her friendly nature and reassuring words helped me and my husband through tough times over the next 1.5 years and finally when Doctor told us pregnancy scan is positive for the first time after the initial shock, our joy knew no bounds as we have been waiting to hear those words for more than 3 years. during the last 8 months I took so much care not to make unnecessary movements and strict diet but despite all this, I experienced labour in my 32nd week of pregnancy. it was a harrowing time for me and my husband as this was a nightmare come real for us. Luckily for us the only thing that kept us going was the constant vigil kept by the nurses and Dr.manjula's reassuring words that despite all this we will deliver the baby normally. and true to her words our baby girl arrived through normal delivery and after 2 weeks of NICU observation, we were delighted to bring our baby girl home. in our family we usually go to mother's hometown for pregnancy after 7th month but I decided way earlier that IAM going ahead with dr.manjula for several reasons and the topmost reason is her ability to reassure me of my doubts and her extreme friendly nature. Now I am going out of way to recommend all our friends and colleagues to go and consult with her.
reply_text: Thank you subasri for your kind words it means a lot to me

review: I have consulted Dr.Manjula Deepak for my Pregnancy Checkup in Cloudnine Hospital HRBR/Horamavu. Initially I choose to consult her by reading online reviews, and later realized that every single word I read about Mam was so true. Through-out my Pregnancy I was very confident that I was in safe hands. She explained everything clearly during consultations. Unnecessary Scans or Tests were not prescribed. To handle problems like nausea, heartburn, cramps etc, she suggested natural ways instead of medication. She always heard my queries and answered them with lot of patience. She was reachable on phone for any doubts/suggestions. She encouraged me for Normal delivery and also suggested lot of physical activities that will help in Normal delivery. She gave me hope till the last minute, but for some other unavoidable reason I had to go for C-Section delivery. She is full of energy, positiveness and confidence. I could see the way she enjoys her work and I really admire that. Me and my husband are glad that we consulted her and we thank Ma'am heart fully for doing a safe delivery for me. Thank you so much Ma'am ! :) :) :) Keep up the good work!

review: I, Lakshmi Bhavya, and my husband Mahesh would like to thank  Dr. Manjula Deepak madam from the bottom of our hearts for doing normal delivery though I had many complications. This was my first pregnancy. We visited Dr. Manjula after seeing very  positive reviews on Practo. As you see in other reviews, she is very friendly, positive  minded, energetic, epathetic and approachable. She always responded to our doubts very quickly on phone. I myself did not expect that I would have a normal delivery as I had complications. I had fibroids which kept increasing in size during pregnancy, got hypothyroidism, gestational diabetes and growth of the baby was not at par with the standard benchmarks. When we were worried about all these, she kept us motivated and kept building our confidence. She did not prescribe  unnecessary medicines and suggested diet and excercises that  helped to have a normal delivery. We had to get admitted to the hospital at 9 pm due to amniotic fluid leakage and delivered at midnight around 2.30. Doctor was available during these odd times and guided the staff to go every thing smoothly. We are fortunate to find Dr. Manjula Deepak and highly recommend her.

review:
I don't know where to start about Dr. Manjula. She's the best thing that happened to us during our pregnancy. We met her as soon as we conceived and it's been 10 months since (our baby girl is a month old). 
She made us feel happy, excited, confident and comfortable in every visit. I used to look forward to our gynaec visits. She's caring and friendly, almost family like. You'll always leave a consultation with a smile on your face after meeting her, that's the level of positivity she exudes. She'd answer all my questions within minutes, silly or otherwise, which is what you need as an expectant mother. 

As for the delivery, I had to have an emergency a C section as my water broke and the labour wasn't progressing.  She tried her best for a normal delivery while monitoring my baby and me for any signs of distress through the night. I have no regrets about the c section as the procedure was equally great with her. I walked the next day and was discharged in a Couple of days. We're proud parents to our baby and are proud to have been with Dr. Manjula during this journey!
Love you, doc!

Some people walk into your life as angels and Dr. Manjula was one such angel who walked into my life ! I visited our Dr. For pregnancy counseling as we were planning to have a baby ! Few months later, when I tested positive for pregnancy, we decided her to be our gynaecologist!! And that's the best thing that happened to us. Since we were first time parents , there were lot of times where we were anxious, worried and nervous. But our Dr. Always and always had a smile on her face and relieved us with all our tension! She encouraged me to live the way I am with only few dietary restrictions. Her hearty welcome to the hospital will make you forget everything and you will really really start enjoying your pregnancy! She treats you like a family and genuinely cares about you, like how our mothers would ! Be it scans, consultations and finally the delivery and post delivery as well she was always there besides us !! My baby and our family really thank her for the support she has given throughout. Words are not enough for an angel like her ! She is an inspiration to many women and how passionate she is about what she does , shows in her work !!! You will always see her bubbly and cheery all the time !!! I wonder how does she do it !!! I wish I could upload a pic of ours with Dr. But I guess practo doesn't have that option !!!! All in all thaaaaaaaaaaaaaank you so much for everything Dr. Manjula!!! 

Yours sincerely
Swati and Ajay

review:
We first read about Dr. Manjula Deepak on Practo, true to every single appreciation out there, she stands amazing! I am indeed short of words to thank and describe how elegantly Dr Manjula doctored the delivery of our first child. By God's grace, with loads of blessings from well wishers and with Doctor's ******** medical advise and assurances, my beautiful wife Naziya delivered a lovely boy :-)

Like any other first timers, we were on tenterhooks about this pregnancy, but it was Dr. Manjula's poise that helped to simmer us down throughout the journey. She is confident, spirited, very friendly and never short on energy :-) Her continuous aplomb gave us the confidence and belief in a normal delivery, and rightly so Naziya delivered normally.

review:
It was an awesome experience with Dr.Manjula* *** ** *** ** *** **** ******* * **** **** *** ** ** ****. She never suggests unnecessary tests and is always concerned that we don't undergo unnecessary expences. 
Visited her first for my first pregnancy. Unfortunately,underwent a miscarriage. She believes in natural way of treatment wherever possible. She asked me to wait and let the cleaning process happen naturally and thankfully no medicine or dnc was needed. Then i went to my hometown for a second opinion. The doctor there exaggerated things up and did too many tests and ultimately told the same thing which dr.manjula had said without doing any tests. This made us trust her even more.
 Then we went ahead with her for my second pregnancy. We were too scared this time but doctor always made sure we were relaxed after every visit. She has a very positive approach in the way she handles her patients. 
She is very hardworking and sincere towards her work.
She always insisted me to walk and exercise during my pregnancy so that i can deliver normally.

And yes,it happened. I delivered a baby boy on 31st march normally. Even during delivery process, she made sure my mind was diverted and she was cracking jokes.
Would always recommend dr.manjula to everyone.

I thank God for Dr. Manjula and grateful for her service, she helped us have the best moment of our life with nothing to be worried about.  Thank all the doctors like Dr. Manjula for your care and support in our well being.

review:
We have doctors in family and close relatives but we never took opinion of anyone to consult Gynecologist, the hospital was very near 700mts from our home so we opted for Cloudnine and we just walked in and took appointment with Dr Manjula Deepak as we saw her for first time and felt good by her talk and friendliness with the patients and staff. I Would like to thank Dr Manjula Deepak for the treatment of my wife and my 2 babies, doctor is very friendly , available all the time though she is busy make sure our queries are answered anytime 24/7, clears all our doubts . Thank you doctor for being their all the time. She is just not a doctor ,she is a friend, family member ,well-wisher and guide .We feel pampered each time we visit the doctor. God‚Äôs gift to all the mother's to be.
I referred my colleague to consult the doctor and she also had normal delivery and she thanked us so much for referring and also we are still referring to our friends.

1st pregnancy ‚Äì baby girl, normal delivery. 
During 5th month pregnancy the amniotic fluid was less and there was blockage in placenta, doctor gave proper supplements and the fluid level increased which prevented preterm birth, also the case was placenta previa. Doctor encouraged us and every time we visit we had positive thoughts as she never spoke any negative thing and made sure my wife will have normal delivery which indeed it was full term 40 weeks. Thanks to doctor. 

2nd pregnancy ‚Äì baby boy, normal delivery.
This time throughout pregnancy the amniotic fluid was beyond high range and the baby growth was more also the head circumference was little high which was problem for normal delivery. But doctor gave strict diet to follow and check for fluid level often and after completion of 37 weeks my wife had normal delivery. 

Lastly I have seen doctor in hospital during day time attending patients in OPD with full enthusiasm and positive mood even though she will be in labor ward during night, the way she manage and carry herself is great. Her energy and commitment towards work is inspiration.

review: I still remember that day when I met Manjula ma'am. We went to hospital for my blood test and nurse saw me crying due to my pregnancy complications. By that time I have already met 4 doctors and none of them gave me a positive hope.  Nurse just asked me to meet Manjula ma'am and I agreed. Me and my husband both shared our problems with details of complications and issues. After listening to everything she was very calm and said don't worry its a "miracle baby" and everything will be fine. We were shocked to see her reaction and calmness but we totally believed and followed her. From the first day she has been our support, the confidence she has given was remarkable. She was available day and night and has patiently handled me throughout my pregnancy. I was very scared looking at the reports all the time but she was very confident from day 1 which was actually our biggest strength. We were alone in Bangalore due to pandemic but with her support we managed all very easily. I can't thank her enough for what she did and the strength and confidence she gave us during these times. I delivered my child early morning and she was there with me. She has always been answering our n no. of questions patiently. She is so dedicated, after my delivery she used to visit me late night, early morning to check if everything is okay. Being always available, either through msg/calls. ******* ***** ** *** **** *** *** No words will be enough in thanking her for bringing our little angel to our lives but still we can only say thank you from the bottom of our heart!!
